programme.title: The Football League Show
programme.desc: Manish Bhasin presents highlights and all the goals from today's fixtures in the Championship, League One and League Two, including Leicester City v Watford at the King Power Stadium, as the hosts continued their quest to be crowned champions. Plus, action from Yeovil Town v Leeds United and Blackpool v Nottingham Forest

programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Swansea City v Cardiff City at the Liberty Stadium. The Gunners were looking for a major boost to their chances of winning the title as they visited the Reds, who may have slipped off the pace over Christmas, but were still aiming for a place in the top four, while the Welsh rivals battled for pride and crucial points. Plus, action from Aston Villa v West Ham United, Chelsea v Newcastle United, Crystal Palace v West Bromwich Albion, Norwich City v Manchester City, Southampton v Stoke City and Sunderland v Hull City

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: The political journalist presents a round-up of the week's stories, interviewing key figures and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents moral and religious discussions on topical issues, live from the Samworth Enterprise Academy in Leicester

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with the Match of the Day team, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures. This programme is simulcast on BBC Radio 5 Live

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams with cooking in common are challenged to scour London's Camden Passage. While Anita Manning's contestants achieve a huge profit on one item, the team advised by Kate Bliss makes money on all three finds. Presented by Tim Wonnacott

programme.title: The Indian Doctor
programme.desc: As the Thomas brothers begin trying to convince the villagers to back their plan for a new town, Aled and Daf decide they need to do something big to stop Basil's development plan. Prem tells Owen that he cannot work in the mine anymore because of his health, and Megan calls at the surgery with some unexpected news

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: France v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). John Inverdale introduces coverage of the concluding match in the second round of fixtures, which takes place at the Stade de France. The hosts endured a diabolical series of results in 2013, which saw them finish bottom of the Six Nations table, with the Italians one point and two places above them. However, they got off to a winning start at home to England this time around and have never lost at home to Italy, who were beaten away to Wales in their opener. With commentary by Andrew Cotter and Jonathan Davies

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: David Grant revisits the heyday of Sunday School classes, and theatre impresario Bill Kenwright reveals how they helped to establish his beloved Everton Football Club. The host also introduces evergreen hymns and songs from congregations, as well as the School Choirs of the Year

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Fake or Fortune?
programme.desc: The focus turns to Britain's public art collections, in which 17,000 paintings are listed as `artist unknown'. From these Philip Mould and his research director Bendor Grosvenor identify several works they believe are by Thomas Gainsborough. They choose two paintings, the first being an 18th-century portrait of St Albans mayor Joseph Gape that Bendor thinks dates back to the artist's days as a high-society portrait painter - although he'll need to convince the world's leading Gainsborough expert. Philip's choice is a rare landscape, painted when the artist was experimenting with dreamlike scenes. But why is conservationist Aviva Burnstock troubled by a distinctive blue pigment? Last in the series

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A trip to the Lake District, to some of the locations featured in the programme's opening titles. Matt Baker visits the beach the horses race across and Blea Tarn, where the wild swimming was filmed, while Helen Skelton recreates the rock-climbing scene and meets the family who pioneered the sport in the area. Ellie Harrison is also in the Lakes, hearing how the area inspired two different artists - German painter Kurt Schwitters and British poet William Wordsworth. Tom Heap is at Spurn Point in East Yorkshire to find out how this thin spit of land has been damaged by the winter storms and Adam Henson is in Kent to visit one of the most expensive bulls in the world. Including Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star

programme.title: The Musketeers
programme.desc: A former Musketeer unexpectedly returns to Paris, throwing the quartet into turmoil as they are fully aware they should report him for desertion. But he has information on the infamous massacre during which his troop was killed and wants old friend Aramis's help in uncovering the truth. The only problem is, his arrival has coincided with a visit from the king's sister and her husband, the Duke of Savoy - and the regiment have been assigned to protect the royal couple. Swashbuckling drama, with Vincent Regan and JJ Feild

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, which featured Tottenham Hotspur v Everton and Manchester United v Fulham at White Hart Lane and Old Trafford respectively, as the Cottagers looked to boost their chances of avoiding the drop, and the other three clubs aimed to improve their chances of a top-four finish

programme.title: Brooklyn's Finest (2009)
programme.desc: Three Brooklyn police officers find their careers converge at a single moment. A veteran on the brink of retirement is presented with a difficult dilemma, a corrupt cop is willing to do whatever it takes to provide for his family and an undercover officer has grown disillusioned with his role and is ready to step down. Crime thriller, starring Richard Gere, Don Cheadle, Ethan Hawke, Wesley Snipes and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman finds out whether Jason and Angie Buchanan decided to permanently leave their native Scotland in favour of a new life in Brisbane. During their trial week in the Australian city one year earlier, some members of the household remained unconvinced by the proposed move - and of particular concern was the level of care that might be afforded to son Jordan, who has cerebral palsy

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a property in Staffordshire, a bungalow in Cumbria and a semi-detached house in Essex. They then follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress after three months

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In a special one-hour edition of the show, antiques experts Charles Hanson and Jonathan Pratt help two teams search for potentially profitable items at Norfolk Showground

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, Russia, where the women's round-robin match between Great Britain and Sweden continues. Each country will play nine fixtures, with the top four then progressing to the semi-finals, and the Swedes are the reigning champions. Commentary from Steve Cram and Jackie Lockhart. Coverage continues on BBC2

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Heston receives a helping hand when he is involved in a minor collision, though things subsequently start to spiral out of control. Meanwhile, Howard is on the warpath, Karen learns a few home truths, and Al appears to be doing someone a favour - but all is not what it seems. Medical drama, starring Owen Brenman, Ian Kelsey, Jan Pearson and Ian Midlane

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: New series. Return of the police drama set in the 1950s, starring Jennie Jacques. In the first episode, Gina becomes embroiled in a feud between fair workers and a gang of Teddy Boys as she searches for a runaway girl in Brinford. Back at the station, she struggles to remain professional when Jack makes a shock announcement, while Fenton clashes with the new DI when a dead body is discovered - distracting them from a wider mystery. With Charlie De'Ath, Ben Turner and John Bowler

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a recently reunited couple with a budget of Â£600,000 search for a property in West Sussex that will be big enough for their six dogs. The presenter also visits the Goodwood Estate and learns how its organic ancestral farm is supporting the preservation of native livestock breeds

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques experts David Harper and Mark Stacey vie to make the most money for their chosen charities by buying and selling various items at Norfolk Showground Antique and Collectors Fair

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Guy Lynn exposes the criminals illegally providing pay-TV services at knockdown prices and Natalie Graham discovers how London was protected from the onslaught of Hitler's doodlebug bombs. Marie Ashby reports on the way in which DNA from the bones of Joseph Merrick - the deformed Victorian who has become known as the Elephant Man - may offer new hope to scientists researching cancer

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat cannot shake the belief that she just saw Stacey, and persuades Alfie to cut short their reunion to go searching for her cousin. Lucy discovers Danny has been embezzling money from the Butcher's Joints accounts and Denise is uncomfortable when Ian offers Fat Boy a job at the restaurant. Nancy and Whitney sign Johnny up for an online dating website - but it seems he's not the only one looking for love when Tamwar discovers Shabnam has been speaking to a mystery man

programme.title: Immigration Undercover
programme.desc: An investigation into Britain's multimillion-pound trade in immigration visas that allow bogus students, some with little or no English, to remain in the UK and work illegally. Richard Watson exposes the fraudulent processes involved, from forging documents such as bank statements to getting fake sitters to take exams in place of the sham students

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman continues his history of the First World War. He looks at how Britain edged closer to defeat in the worst conflict it had ever known and Germany's attempt to starve the country into submission, which led to rationing, prompting the publication of the Win-the-War Cookery Book. Anyone found hoarding food was put on trial as newspapers exposed how the rich dined out on lobsters in London's Mayfair. Meanwhile, a film of fighting in the trenches broke box-office records - but what effect did it have on the British public's desire for peace?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Have I Got Old News for You
programme.desc: Cockney hardman Ray Winstone proves he's the daddy once more as he guest-hosts this edition of the comedy news quiz from April 2013, which sees Paul Merton and Ian Hislop poke fun at news stories with the help of their celebrity panellists, comedian Reginald D Hunter and journalist Camilla Long

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? USA
programme.desc: Actor Jim Parsons, best known to fans of The Big Bang Theory as Sheldon Cooper, sets out to explore his father's family tree. The search takes him to New Orleans and the story of his great-great-grandfather JB Hacker, a doctor who lived through the yellow fever outbreak of the 1850s. He then follows the trail of his great-great-grandmother Adele Drouet, which leads him to Paris and the discovery of an ancestor with royal connections

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham's guests include British film star Gary Oldman, who appears in the remake of 1987 sci-fi movie RoboCop, actor Nick Frost, soon to be seen in the dance comedy Cuban Fury, and Australian actress Toni Collette, who discusses her TV show Hostages. London Grammar provide the music and the host also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.desc: Catching up with the Afanasievs, who spent a week living in Sydney two years ago, and were shocked by the high local property prices and worried about their children missing time with their grandparents. Nicki Chapman discovers whether the family moved to Australia for good or decided to stay in the UK

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

They later return to find out how the new owners have progressed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is still in turmoil about what she believes she saw, so talks to someone she thinks will understand - but things get a little awkward when Alfie is late for their hospital appointment. Tamwar confides in Shabnam about the future of the market, so she swallows her pride and accepts a job at the Minute Mart. The news that Janine is selling off her share of the restaurant worries Ian, who is desperate to protect his empire, while Billy is devastated that he, Lucy and Danny are now unemployed. However, his Butcher's Joints colleagues have a plan up their sleeve - and it doesn't involve him. Johnny is shocked to find out the identity of his online date

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jonny is dismayed when Jac risks being late for Emma's christening to help Elliot operate on a patient with a rare heart condition not seen at the hospital in more than a decade. Harry becomes determined to find his own area of specialism after seeing Raf being photographed by a medical journal for his work with the resus team, while a man with an abscess in his rectum refuses to be operated on by a woman, but the only male surgeon Serena can find is Guy - and it's well outside his comfort zone

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Everton midfielder Leon Osman, former world snooker champion Shaun Murphy, Paralympic gold medallist sprinter Richard Whitehead and ex-rugby league winger Martin Offiah join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quickfire quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: Film 2014
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman and Danny Leigh review the latest big-screen releases, including The Monuments Men, George Clooney's ensemble drama telling the story of an unlikely Second World War platoon given the task of retrieving works of art plundered by the Nazis. They also cast an eye over Nick Frost's salsa dance comedy Cuban Fury

programme.title: The Hoax (2006)
programme.desc: Drama set in the 1970s, based on the true story of Clifford Irving, a struggling author who managed to convince a publisher that business magnate Howard Hughes had personally hired him as a biographer. Banking on the reclusive billionaire being too publicity shy to contradict his claims, Irving offered the rights to the book for $1million. But keeping up the deception demanded an ever more complex web of lies. With Richard Gere, Alfred Molina, Hope Davis and Marcia Gay Harden

At the time, Lucy was determined to convince her partner that Australia was where they should be, but he and the children were reluctant to leave their lives behind in the UK

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a cottage in Cornwall, a house in Ashford, Kent, and a mid-terrace in Northumberland, before finding out who bought the properties and what they sold for at auction

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Along with experts Mark Stacey and David Harper, presenter Tim Wonnacott joins the teams in Grimsthorpe, Lincolnshire, as a newly engaged couple take on a duo who have been happily married for 43 years. They are advised and guided by experts Mark Stacey and David Harper before finding out if their items make any profit when they are sold at auction in Mackworth, Derbyshire

Coverage continues on BBC2

programme.desc: Zara realises something about her own behaviour as she mediates between two brothers who are harbouring family resentments from the past. programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: WPC Gina Dawson is beginning to enjoy being undercover as Ruby, but struggles with her growing feelings for Chris. Rosie becomes increasingly horrified by what is happening at the brothel and plans to leave, but she later finds Ned beating Rebecca, so helps her to escape instead. Police drama set in the 1950s, starring Jennie Jacques and Charlie De'Ath

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family with a budget of Â£700,000 find a country retreat in Hampshire where three generations can live together. While in the county, Jules visits England's oldest almshouses

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: David Harper and Mark Stacey compete at a car-boot sale at Ford Airfield in West Sussex. They each have Â£250 to spend as they try to outdo each other and make the most profit. Plus, a look at what happens when one dealer breaks his opponent's antique

programme.title: Pointless

At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kevin is a bag of nerves as his university bursary interview looms, despite the presence of Chalky, who has made a welcome return to support his foster son. But when the anxious student collapses and is rushed to hospital, it sends shockwaves through the school. Nikki frantically tries to keep Vix in the dark about her one-night stand with Hector, but after vindictive Gabriella finds out, she sets out to destroy her teacher's relationship, and Lula's excitement at being offered a university place is short-lived when her family is threatened with deportation

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Pete's goddaughter comes to stay from Australia, but her arrival has an unfortunate effect on the Brockman household - especially as Sue and Jake also have visitors. Meanwhile, Ben's role in Spartacus: The Musical is under threat. Family comedy, guest starring Emily Berrington (The White Queen), alongside Claire Skinner and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes looks after a robotic baby that has been given to Dermot and Maria to help them prepare for their new arrival, but uses unorthodox methods to stop the fake infant from crying. Meanwhile, Cathy develops a crush on her psychology lecturer. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the midweek Premier League matches, which include Arsenal v Manchester United at the Emirates Stadium and Manchester City v Sunderland at the Etihad Stadium. The Gunners and City were looking for home wins to boost their chances of winning the title, with the champions and the Black Cats aiming to do the double over their respective opponents. Plus, action from Cardiff City v Aston Villa, Hull City v Southampton, West Ham United v Norwich City, West Bromwich Albion v Chelsea, Everton v Crystal Palace, Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur, Stoke City v Swansea City and Fulham v Liverpool

programme.title: The Mother (2003)
programme.desc: A lonely widow decides to move in with her daughter, yearning for the company of her children and grandchildren, but their new domestic arrangement causes problems when the older woman embarks on an ill-advised but passionate affair with a much younger man - who just happens to be her offspring's boyfriend. Drama by writer Hanif Kureishi, starring Anne Reid, Daniel Craig, Cathryn Bradshaw and Steven Mackintosh

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the opening session on day two of the Games. The snowboarding gets the day's action under way at the Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, Russia, with the first run in the women's slopestyle semi-final at 6.30, followed by the second run at 8.00, and concluding with the final at 9.15, with Britain's Jenny Jones expected to be a realistic medal contender, having won three X Games golds in recent years. The alpine skiing takes place at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort and begins with the blue riband event of the Games - the men's downhill at 7.00. Switzerland's Didier Defago claimed gold four years ago in Canada, winning by a margin of just seven hundredths of a second. Matt Chilton and Graham Bell are the commentators. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: The Gumball Rally (1976)
programme.desc: A wealthy man sponsors a madcap illegal coast-to-coast motor race from New York to California, prompting a host of eccentric characters to take to the road in their customised cars. However, a bungling police detective is determined to put a stop to the racers' antics. Comedy, starring Michael Sarrazin, Tim McIntire, Raul Julia and Gary Busey

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage of the second day from Russia, featuring cross-country skiing and speed skating highlights from 2.30, live biathlon from 3.00 and live figure skating and luge from 3.30. The cross-country at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana featured the men's 30km skiathlon discipline, while the medals were decided in the speed skating at the Adler Arena in Sochi, in the women's 3,000m event. The biathlon at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex sees the women's 7.5km sprint medals confirmed, and the figure skating features the inaugural staging of the men's team category at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, interspersed with the third and penultimate run in the men's singles luge at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents concluding coverage from the second day of the Games in Russia, featuring figure skating and luge from 5.10, and ski jumping from 6.30. The team figure skating concludes with the team free ice dance discipline at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, while the men's singles luge reaches a climax with the fourth run at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana. Attention then switches to the first ski jumping medals to be decided at the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana, where the competitors take on the second and final jump in the men's individual Normal Hill event. The ski jumping medals in Vancouver were shared by five nations, but Simon Amman was the star of the Games, winning both this event and the Large Hill, although Switzerland finished outside the medals in the team discipline, which was won by Austria. This year's Games will also feature a women's jump, which takes place at this venue on Tuesday. Paul Dickenson and Colin Bryce are the commentators for the luge. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day two in Russia, where eight gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. The alpine skiing was one of the sports to get under way today, as the men's downhill garnered much of the attention on the slopes at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort, while the inaugural women's snowboarding slopestyle champion was crowned at the Rosa Khutor Extreme Park, and the women's ice hockey group match between Russia and Germany took place at the Shayba Arena in Sochi. The men's downhill is traditionally seen as the blue riband event of any Games, and Didier Defago of Switzerland won the gold medal four years ago in Vancouver, with Norway's Aksel Lund Svindal a close second and Bode Miller of the USA in third. Miller's medal helped his country to an outstanding haul of eight, twice as many as their nearest rivals Norway and Austria

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: More hopefuls bid to win funding for their projects from the panel. A couple go all-out to gain interest in their glamorous camping business, a mother-of-four from Shropshire has a new take on the coffee bag and the Dragons are in for a surprise when an entrepreneur attempts to graffiti the Den. Evan Davis presents

programme.title: Alan Davies Apres-Ski
programme.desc: The comedian and a selection of guests from the worlds of comedy, entertainment and sport take an irreverent look at all the news and action from the Winter Olympics in Sochi, celebrating what makes the Games special

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents an extended version of the quiz, and unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining what impact the relationships between cousins Nicholas II of Russia, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany and George V of the United Kingdom had on the outbreak of the First World War. This episode focuses on the story of the emerging divisions and rivalries between the inter-related royal houses of Europe during the 19th century. Featuring contributions by historians Karina Urbach, Miranda Carter and Piers Brendon. Tamsin Greig narrates

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Worcestershire is the setting this week as Matt Baker visits the ruins of Witley Court, one of England's most stunning country houses until it burnt down in 1937. Helen Skelton hunts for the creatures that live in Wyre Forest and finds out how the local orchards are essential for winter birds, before Jules Hudson hears about the upkeep of the Severn Valley Railway. Tom Heap discovers how discarded food could be turned into pigswill and Adam Henson meets a Somerset farmer battling on despite 95 per cent of his land being flooded

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As Sacha continues to put his students through a punishing teaching schedule, Arthur begins to let his Doctor of the Year award go to his head, so Dominic plans to take his rival down a peg or two - and he gets the perfect chance when the pair of them are assigned to the same case. Serena is furious at being sent to cover AAU, but when an intriguing patient presents a business opportunity, she thinks she may have finally found a way to prove her worth to Guy. Jonny feels left out when Jac steams ahead with her plans for Emma

programme.title: The Search for Alfred the Great
programme.desc: Neil Oliver follows the work of the team of historians and scientists trying to discover the final resting place of the remains of 9th-century English king Alfred the Great, with the monarch's bones having been moved so many times over the years that many people concluded that they were lost for ever. Travelling from Winchester to Rome, Neil also tells the story of Alfred's life, revealing a man who forged a united language and identity and laid the foundations of the English nation

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage from day three of the Games in Russia, featuring curling, alpine skiing and short track speed skating. The Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi is the first port of call at 5.00 as Britain's men's team begin their round-robin campaign against Russia, with a further live update at 7.45 following the alpine skiing at 6.45 at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort near Krasnaya Polyana. The women's super combined discipline is the focus on the slopes today, starting with the downhill section, followed by the slalom run at 11.00. Matt Chilton and Emma Carrick-Anderson provide the commentary. Attention returns to curling at 9.45 as the British women, who are highly fancied after winning last year's World Championship, get their campaign under way against defending Olympic champions Sweden, with coverage switching between this and short track speed skating at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi. The heats of the men's 1500m and women's 500m are the first to take place at these Games, with British medal prospect Elise Christie among those looking to move through to Thursday's quarter-finals. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage from day three of the Games in Russia, featuring curling, alpine skiing and short track speed skating. The Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi is the first port of call at 5.00 as Britain's men's team begin their round-robin campaign against Russia, with a further live update at 7.45 following the alpine skiing at 6.45 at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort near Krasnaya Polyana. The women's super combined discipline is the focus on the slopes today, starting with the downhill section, followed by the slalom run at 11.00. Matt Chilton and Emma Carrick-Anderson provide the commentary. Attention returns to curling at 9.45 as the British women, who are highly fancied after winning last year's World Championship, get their campaign under way against defending Olympic champions Sweden, with coverage switching between this and short track speed skating at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi. The heats of the men's 1500m and women's 500m are the first to take place at these Games, with British medal prospect Elise Christie among those looking to move through to Thursday's quarter-finals. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage from Russia on day three of the Games, featuring women's ice hockey and men's curling. The ice hockey is the first action of the afternoon from 1.00 at the Shayba Arena in Sochi, where Group A continued with USA v Switzerland. This was the second round-robin fixture for both sides in a group that also contains Canada and Finland, and all four of those will feature in the knockout stage, with the top two having the added advantage of a bye to the semi-finals, while the bottom two move into the quarter-finals. At 3.00, the focus switches across the Olympic Park to the Ice Cube Curling Centre and the men's round-robin match between Great Britain and Sweden, as both teams play their second tie of the day. A place in the top four is the aim for both, with a total of nine round-robin fixtures to take place for each, and British skip David Murdoch will be well aware of the history between the nations, given that Sweden eliminated his men in a play-off four years ago in Vancouver

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of the concluding events on day three in Russia, featuring curling, speed skating, biathlon, luge and freestyle skiing. The focus is initially on the conclusion of the men's round-robin match between Great Britain and Sweden at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, followed by highlights of the men's 500m speed skating final at the Adler Arena, also in the host city. Plus, there is a chance to see biathlon action from the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana, where the men's 12.5km pursuit race took place, and the opening run in the women's luge singles at the Sliding Centre Sanki, before the final live coverage of the day at 6.00. That features the freestyle skiing at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park near Krasnaya Polyana, where the men's moguls final is scheduled to be played out over three runs. Alexandre Bilodeau of Canada claimed gold four years ago on home soil, and is among the favourites again having finished second in last year's World Championships. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day three in Russia, where five gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Alpine skiing, biathlon, freestyle skiing, short track speed skating and speed skating were the sports in which medals were won, with the women's super combined being the focus of attention at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort. Germany's Maria Hoefl-Riesch won one of two gold medals in Vancouver four years ago in this discipline, and is still among the leading contenders in an event that requires outstanding ability in both downhill and slalom forms of the sport. Elsewhere, the biathlon continued at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana with another gruelling test, as the men took part in the 12.5km pursuit, which was won by Bjorn Ferry of Sweden four years ago

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-finals continue, with two teams of four students battling it out to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Half of British families struggle to share a meal more than three times a week and yet people relish the sense of togetherness it gives them. Richard Corrigan joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to prepare a hearty chicken and crayfish pie ideal for a gathering, while drinks expert Kate Goodman comes up with ales to suit the occasion and chef Andy Bates joins the team for a debate about the future of family dining

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The programme goes behind the scenes at Nasa to discover how the space agency is preparing for its most ambitious and daring mission yet - to land a manned craft on the surface of Mars. Reaching the planet would involve a journey of at least three years, and the film meets the scientists and engineers who are designing new rockets and spacesuits, as well as finding ways to help astronauts survive the perils of such a long voyage

programme.title: The Culture Show
programme.desc: To mark the release of The Lego Movie on Friday, Tom Dyckhoff explores the toy's relationship with architecture - and argues that it has changed the way people think about buildings. He meets artists and architects who played with it as children and who are using it to reimagine cities today, and looks at how cult computer game Minecraft may be set to transform urban landscapes of the future. With contributions by Alain de Botton, Peter Molyneux, Bjarke Ingels, Mark Dudek and Olafur Eliasson

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part two of two. The documentary examines the key role played by royalty in smoothing the path to the Anglo-Russian entente of 1907, and the part played by the Kaiser's erratic, unstable personality in the growing isolation of Germany in the years leading up to 1914. The film also explores the roles played by the German, British and Russian monarchs in the months leading up to the outbreak of the First World War and tells the story of George V's refusal to grant his cousin Nicholas II asylum in England following the Russian Revolution of 1917

programme.title: Letters of Service
programme.desc: Drama inspired by a true story in which a nurse pieces together the haunted past of a 100-year-old psychiatric patient, about whom nothing is known except his date of birth and his name, Billy Dunne. The old man has lived in the hospital his entire adult life and doesn't speak, but spends all his time furiously sketching eerie, disjointed images on postcards - through which his past finally emerges. Starring Morris Perry and Chloe Bale

programme.title: Film 2014
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman and Danny Leigh provide their thoughts on the latest big-screen releases. Up for discussion are the reboot of 1987 sci-fi favourite RoboCop, with Gary Oldman, Dallas Buyers Club, starring Matthew McConaughey as 1980s Aids activist Ron Woodroof, and Ralph Fiennes' The Invisible Woman, which tells the story of Charles Dickens' extramarital affair

programme.title: Inspire
programme.desc: Gabby Logan meets members of the British Sailing squad in Weymouth, who are hoping to follow in Ben Ainslie's footsteps at the 2016 Rio Games. Plus, Denise Lewis heads to Stratford to talk to 400m world champion Christine Ohuruogu, and some of Britain's most promising young boxers are profiled in Sheffield ahead of next month's World Amateur Championships

programme.title: Russia on Four Wheels
programme.desc: Part one of two. Justin Rowlatt and Anita Rani set off on separate road trips across Russia from Sochi, the Black Sea resort hosting the 2014 Winter Olympics. Anita travels north and west in a Kombat, a Russian-built luxury armour-plated vehicle, and enters a thriving world of westernised entrepreneurs who are at the forefront of shaping a new and vibrant country. Meanwhile, Justin heads east in a Soviet-built UAZ jeep, encountering a world that seems hardly to have changed since the Cold War

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Inside the Human Body
programme.desc: Michael Mosley explores the workings of the human body and tells the stories of people who have pushed their bodies to the absolute limit

programme.title: Schools - Get Lost
programme.desc: Three young people discover how to navigate the traditional way - by using only contours and a compass - as they are challenged to reach a destination using Ordnance Survey maps. Presented by Joe Crowley

programme.title: Schools - Curious Cat
programme.desc: Three short films designed to help children studying Key Stage 1 Material Science learn about wool, glass and paper

programme.title: Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: A look at stoats as they interact and play outside in the wild

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a property in Staffordshire, a bungalow in Cumbria and a semi-detached house in Essex. They then follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress after three months

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening events on day four of the Games in Russia, featuring freestyle skiing and curling. The first action features highlights from the qualifying session for the women's slopestyle freestyle skiing discipline at 7.00 at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park near Krasnaya Polyana, as the line-up for this morning's final was decided. That final is live at 9.00, and British hopes rest with teenager Katie Summerhayes, who is regarded as a medal prospect having proved her fitness ahead of the Games following a spate of injuries. The curling begins at 7.50 with highlights of the women's round-robin match between Sweden and Canada at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, followed by live coverage from the men's competition at 10.00, as Great Britain take to the ice for their fixture against Germany. Plus, news from the women's ice hockey and men's snowboarding half-pipe qualifying. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage of day four from Russia, featuring cross-country skiing, speed skating, snowboarding and curling. The first focus is on the cross-country skiing at 1.00, live from the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana, where the finals of the men's and women's individual sprint disciplines take place. Highlights of the first run of the women's 500m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in Sochi are at 1.45, with the qualifying session for the men's snowboarding half-pipe at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana at 2.15. The live coverage resumes at 3.00 with the women's curling round-robin match between Great Britain and the USA at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, and the semi-finals of the men's snowboarding half-pipe discipline. Plus, updates from the third run in the final of the women's luge and the women's 10km biathlon pursuit

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces further coverage from Russia, featuring live curling, snowboarding and figure skating, as the day's events reach a conclusion. The curling continues from 4.00 at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, as Great Britain and the USA face each other in the round-robin section of the women's draw. Arguably the Winter Olympics' biggest star, Shaun White, will expect to be involved in the men's snowboarding half-pipe final at 5.30 at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park, Krasnaya Polyana, having won gold at both the 2006 and 2010 Games, with the qualifiers and semi-finals having taken place earlier in the day. The final coverage of the day comes from the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi from 6.30, where the pairs' short figure skating programme comes to a climax, ahead of tomorrow's free discipline which will decide the destination of the medals. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day four in Russia, where five gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Much of today's attention would be on Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, and the men's snowboarding, which saw the half-pipe final take place. Shaun White has become one of the leading names in winter sports since snowboarding has increased in popularity and prestige at the Winter Games, and the Flying Tomato was favourite to win a third gold in this event, and add to a tally of success in the sport that is hard to match. Biathlon, cross-country skiing, luge, freestyle skiing, speed skating and ski jumping were the other sports that saw champions crowned, with British youngster Katie Summerhayes a medal hope in the women's slopestyle freestyle skiing event

programme.title: Children's Emergency Rescue
programme.desc: Twins are taken ill with the same life-threatening condition and a heart surgeon is flown home from holiday in America to operate on an infant. Documentary following a team of doctors and nurses caring for some of the UK's sickest children and infants as they are transported to specialist centres around the country. Narrated by Fiona Bruce. Last in the series

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines why the most intelligent animals on the planet are also the most social. Swimming with a pod of dolphins in the Bahamas, he explores their language and learns how they are able to recognise themselves in a mirror. He also witnesses the deviousness of chimpanzees and watches elephants as they mourn their dead. Last in the series

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: Vic invites Bob's ex-wife Erika over as a surprise for his birthday, not realising she is intent on killing her former husband. The housemates decide to tell her that Bob is dead and attempt to safely steer Erika back to Norway without her finding out the truth, but she turns out to be a lot more fun than any of them had anticipated. Comedy, guest starring Sofia Ledarp

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: More hopefuls bid to win funding for their projects from the panel. A couple go all-out to gain interest in their glamorous camping business, a mother-of-four from Shropshire has a new take on the coffee bag and the Dragons are in for a surprise when an entrepreneur attempts to graffiti the Den. Evan Davis presents

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Wigan Warriors v Huddersfield Giants. Tanya Arnold presents highlights of the opening fixture of the season at the DW Stadium. This match saw the champions begin the defence of their title at home to the side that finished top of the regular standings at the end of the last campaign. Plus, a profile of all 14 clubs and how they are expected to fare this season

programme.title: Inspire
programme.desc: Magazine series presented by Gabby Logan, taking an in-depth look at the stories behind the sports and focusing on promising and high-profile sportsmen and women

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past

programme.title: Vultures
programme.desc: Cameraman and naturalist Charlie Hamilton James travels to eastern Africa to try to show a different side to the much-maligned vulture, which he believes is a beautiful and intelligent bird that deserves respect. He reveals not only a softer, more caring side to the species, but also finds evidence that a carcass was deliberately poisoned and laid out for the raptors to feed on, resulting in numerous deaths

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - One Hundred Years of the Women's Movement
programme.desc: Radio 1 DJ Gemma Cairney embarks on a personal journey through the history of the women's movement, investigating landmark events such as winning the right to vote and the sexual revolution of the 1960s

programme.title: Fit to Rule
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley presents six short films examining the impact the mental and physical health of monarchs, including Henry VIII, Edward VI, Mary I, Charles I and George III, has had on history. She also explores how childbirth has always been one of the royal family's greatest biological challenges

programme.title: Schools - True Stories
programme.desc: Part one of two. The stories of 10 people who changed the world, beginning with Florence Nightingale, Alexander Graham Bell, Harriet Tubman, Isambard Kingdom Brunel and Mary Anning

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: Footage of knot birds flying in formation over the sea. Documentary series comprising 20 short films celebrating wildlife and the natural world. Using beautiful imagery and inspiring music, each explores a particular theme

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage from Russia on day five of the Games, including downhill alpine skiing, ice hockey and curling. The Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana is the first port of call at 7.00 for the latest event from the alpine skiing schedule, as the medals are decided in the women's downhill. The absence through injury of defending champion Lindsey Vonn is something of a blow to the prestige of the competition, but a high-quality field will be looking to succeed the American and write a new chapter of Olympic history. Action from yesterday's ski jumping and figure skating follows at 8.00, with the women's ice hockey group fixture between Finland and Switzerland from 9.00 at the Shayba Arena in Sochi, and women's curling at 10.00 from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, where the round-robin stage continues with the match between Great Britain and Canada. This represents a tough test for Eve Muirhead and her squad, with Canada finishing as runners-up four years ago after topping the standings during the round-robin phase. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day five in Russia, featuring Nordic Combined skiing highlights, and live ice hockey, curling and speed skating. The men's Nordic Combined individual 10km Gundersen event starts the programme at 1.00 at the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana, with action from the ski jump and cross-country elements of the sport. Live ice hockey coverage gets under way at 1.30 at the Shayba Arena in Sochi, joining the women's group match between the USA and Canada in progress, with both sides aiming to book a place in the semi-finals. That is followed at 3.00 by the men's curling round-robin match between Great Britain and Switzerland at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, as the race to qualify for the last four continues, interspersed with the men's 1,000m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in the same city

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage through to the end of the fifth day of the Games in Russia, including live luge, figure skating and curling. The Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana is the first port of call at 4.00 for the second and concluding run in the luge doubles final, where Germany will be looking to end their recent gold medal drought, having traditionally dominated the discipline. Attention then returns to the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi for the conclusion of the men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and Switzerland at 4.30, before the figure skating at 5.15 ends the day's live coverage. The Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi is the venue as the medals are decided in the pairs' free programme, with the leading couples from yesterday's short discipline battling it out to succeed Chinese duo Shen Xue and Zhao Hongbo as champions, and there will be high hopes of a home victory given Russia's strength in the sport. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day five in Russia, where six gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. The women's snowboarding half-pipe final was one of the day's key events at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, with Australia's Torah Bright looking to successfully retain the title she won in Vancouver in 2010. Alpine skiing, figure skating, speed skating, Nordic Combined skiing and luge were the other sports to see medals decided, with much of the focus being on Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort for the women's alpine skiiing downhill discipline. Lindsey Vonn was denied the chance to defend her crown as she succumbed to a knee injury that has troubled her for some time, leaving the field wide open in one of the Games' pivotal events

programme.title: The Restaurant Man
programme.desc: Russell Norman comes to the aid of Debbie Quinn, who has sunk her retirement nest egg into opening a Swedish diner in Macclesfield, Cheshire.Â He is adamant she needs to stop treating her restaurant as a hobby and start thinking like a professional, and is shocked to find that she has no head for figures at all. As launch night looms, Debbie is running out of money, hasn't thought about her service and has done no marketing. Will Russell be able to help her make the business a success?

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: New series. The return of the crime thriller about a police anti-corruption unit. DI Lindsay Denton is the sole survivor of the ambush of a police convoy in which three of her colleagues are killed and a witness is seriously injured. AC-12's commanding officer Ted Hastings assigns new recruit Georgia Trotman to work alongside Steve Arnott on the investigation, and suspicions are soon raised about Denton. Starring Adrian Dunbar, Keeley Hawes, Martin Compston and Jessica Raine

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Gerald and Sabrina's modernist home has lots of beautiful things in it of extremely high value. So when cat-burglars Ray and Eddie decide to break into the luxury house, they have to dodge all manner of obstacles - including the warring couple who live there - to get their hands on a priceless painting. Starring Denis Lawson and Oona Chaplin

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Ladette to Lady
programme.desc: The three remaining ladettes sit final examinations in all the skills they have learned, including flower arranging and cookery. An aristocratic audience and the contestants' families assemble for the graduation ceremony, and a touching reunion takes place when an unexpected guest arrives. Mrs Harbord reveals that the contest is the closest she has ever witnessed, before the 2010 winner is announced. Narrated by Ben Gooder. Last in the series

programme.desc: Text-based information service

programme.desc: Animated fun with Pat the hippopotamus and Stan the dog

programme.desc: Fun for younger viewers with the group of tin can-like animals that love finding something new and worthy of attention in the most mundane of items

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Fun for the young, including Almost Naked Animals, Horrid Henry, Victorious and Bottom Knocker Street

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica enters the world of haute couture to solve a series of murders committed in the seedy surroundings of a Parisian sweatshop. The lover of a model who helped her research a book is targeted by a killer in Paris. Angela Lansbury stars

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team head for Royal Leamington Spa in Warwickshire, where they examine a pair of unusual flambe bowls and an ornate mantelpiece. David Ford also takes a chance on a set of antique fishing rods

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV London Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: The Unforgettable Dudley Moore
programme.desc: A profile of the actor and musician best known for his comedy partnership with Peter Cook and as an unlikely Hollywood star. Friends reflect on Moore's extraordinary career, from the early days of stage revue Beyond the Fringe in the 1960s to the critical and commercial success of the film Arthur in 1981, for which he received an Oscar nomination. Ex-wife Brogan Lane talks about Moore's life in LA and close companion Rena Fruchter remembers helping him through the final years of his life, during which he battled a debilitating illness

programme.title: Inside the National Trust
programme.desc: In Cumbria, Michael Buerk tries his hand at being a bug guide in the garden of William Wordsworth's childhood home, and there are admissions to aristocratic scrumping at nearby Sizergh Castle. Meanwhile at Wimpole Hall, Cambridgeshire, trainee farm manager Abi is in charge of harvest for the first time, but a power cut threatens to ruin things

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter Diaries
programme.desc: Country music group the Dixie Chicks try their hand at feeding the crocodiles, while Steve has a photo session with one of the world's most attractive women, and surfers are caught out by an apparently dangerous stunt. Presented by Steve Irwin

programme.title: Splash!
programme.desc: Former rugby union player Austin Healey, TOWIE star Dan Osborne, TV presenter Anna Williamson and Paralympic gold medallist Richard Whitehead don their swimwear once more to perform two dives each in the second semi-final. Mentored by Tom Daley, they're aiming to impress the judges and the voting public to win a place in next week's final alongside Perri Kiely and Keith Duffy, but two of them will have to battle it out in the Splash Off. Vernon Kay and Gabby Logan present

programme.title: Thunderball (1965)
programme.desc: James Bond travels to the Bahamas on the trail of two nuclear warheads stolen from a British aircraft. The lethal weapons have fallen into the hands of international crime syndicate Spectre, which plans to fire them at the US coast unless an exorbitant ransom is paid. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger, Adolfo Celi and Lois Maxwell

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following the elimination of Bonnie Langford, the seven remaining stars bring out the leg warmers and colourful costumes in a celebration of all things 1984 as the show marks the 30th anniversary of Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean winning gold at the Sarajevo Winter Olympics. The duo provide a special routine on the ice and the contestants all perform to songs from that year as they battle to win viewers' votes and praise from the judges. Phillip Schofield and Christine Bleakley present. The results are at 8.30pm

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Olympic rowing hero Steve Redgrave and Emmerdale's Natalie Anderson (Alicia Metcalfe) are joined by their families to answer a series of seemingly simple questions based on a survey of 100 members of the public. The winning team then goes on to the Big Money round, where a jackpot of Â£30,000 can be won for charity. Vernon Kay hosts the long-running game show

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The two skaters who gained the least support from the public earlier tonight attempt to show they have what it takes to be the next - and last - Dancing on Ice champion, but the judges can save only one of them. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Christine Bleakley

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: With news of the first horrors of war in Belgium, the men of Selfridges clamour to sign up, while Rose, Delphine and Lady Mae organise a special chocolate sale to aid refugees - which goes down a treat in the store and proves inspirational for Miss Mardle. Thackeray suspects Henri is up to no good, Victor faces a family crisis and Loxley gets his shady money-making plans off the ground

programme.desc: The veteran DJ, currently celebrating 50 years in broadcasting, looks back on his life and career, which included launching Radio 1 in 1967 and, more recently, being banned from the airwaves for playing Cliff Richard records. programme.desc: Moira is delighted when she and James secure the business deal and is pleasantly surprised as Cain manages to bite his tongue with her brother-in-law. That evening, Cain is shocked when she proposes to him. How will he respond? Meanwhile, Harriet encourages Bob to set up a secret camera to catch the thief targeting the cafe, and Bernice looks forward to a date

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Anna and Fiz get a shock when they try to contact Roy at his Auntie Jean's to tell him about a leak in the cafe. Rob and Tracy argue over Tina, who announces she is leaving the Street, while a jealous Dennis hatches a scheme after Eva suggests Gloria fancies Ritchie. Michelle and Steve make up, and Marcus is disconcerted to find Todd flirting with him

programme.title: A Great Welsh Adventure with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: In a lighthouse on the northernmost tip of mainland Wales, Griff discovers his Conwy challenge - to track down a Welsh dresser. Catching the vintage local bus into nearby Llandudno, the funnyman realises the seaside resort is probably the last place on Earth where he might find antique Welsh furniture. After spending the afternoon pondering his predicament, he hitches a lift into farming country, but has little success. Back on the coast, he spots something familiar in a shop window, but is it the genuine article?

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Anna reluctantly agrees when Fiz insists they phone the police to inform them Roy is missing, and Tracy invites Rob to join her and Amy for tea - much to Deirdre's dismay. Tina is hopeful Peter will turn up at her leaving do in the Rovers, while Dennis, Ritchie and Gloria hold a business meeting, leaving Rita out on a limb. Elsewhere, Jason resents his dad presenting Eva with a designer scarf for her birthday, Marcus gives Todd his mobile number, and Steve and Andrea agree to be friends again

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detective now has a murder inquiry on his hands as the body found on the moors is identified as 11-year-old Andre Petri. With Kyle Heath still missing, Banks divides his team to search for a connection between the cases, and when post-mortem examinations show Andre was killed by a heroin overdose, it appears the two boys are linked by the illegal drug trade. Starring Stephen Tompkinson, with Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz, Christine Bottomley and John Lightbody

programme.title: The Mighty Mississippi with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: The broadcaster embarks on a journey through the heart of America, following the course of its famous river. He begins by exploring the legacy of slavery in the Deep South, and is invited to witness a jazz funeral, unique to New Orleans. He makes a poignant visit to rare surviving plantation slave-quarters and has an encounter with an alligator in America's largest swamp

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Midsomer resident and biscuit factory boss Eric Calder leads Barnaby and Nelson to Copenhagen. The pair join forces with local female detectives Birgitte Poulsen and Anna Degn in the hunt for the killer, and during the course of their investigation they discover the businessman had numerous links to the capital. Anglo-Danish collaboration marking Midsomer's 100th episode, guest starring Ann Eleonora Jorgensen (The Killing), Birgitte Hjort Sorensen (Borgen), Sanjeev Bhaskar and Joanna Scanlan, alongside Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee. programme.desc: Anna and Fiz get a shock when they try to contact Roy at his Auntie Jean's to tell him about a leak in the cafe. Michelle and Steve make up, and Marcus is disconcerted to find Todd flirting with him

programme.title: A Great Welsh Adventure with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: In a lighthouse on the northernmost tip of mainland Wales, Griff discovers his Conwy challenge - to track down a Welsh dresser. Catching the vintage local bus into nearby Llandudno, the funnyman realises the seaside resort is probably the last place on Earth where he might find antique Welsh furniture. After spending the afternoon pondering his predicament, he hitches a lift into farming country, but has little success. Back on the coast, he spots something familiar in a shop window, but is it the genuine article?

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Anna reluctantly agrees when Fiz insists they phone the police to inform them Roy is missing, and Tracy invites Rob to join her and Amy for tea - much to Deirdre's dismay. Elsewhere, Jason resents his dad presenting Eva with a designer scarf for her birthday, Marcus gives Todd his mobile number, and Steve and Andrea agree to be friends again

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detective now has a murder inquiry on his hands as the body found on the moors is identified as 11-year-old Andre Petri. With Kyle Heath still missing, Banks divides his team to search for a connection between the cases, and when post-mortem examinations show Andre was killed by a heroin overdose, it appears the two boys are linked by the illegal drug trade. Starring Stephen Tompkinson, with Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz, Christine Bottomley and John Lightbody

Comedy, guest starring Mercedes Ruehl, with Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles reaches the end of his tether with Maris, and decides to retaliate - but she turns the tables by throwing him out and asking for a divorce. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: The Taste
programme.desc: The contestants use recipes passed down through the generations to impress Nigella Lawson, Anthony Bourdain and Ludo Lefebvre, and emotions run high as they try to do their mothers and fathers, grandparents and godparents proud. However, after the blind tastings another cook has to head home. The immunity challenge is set by guest chef Ruth Rogers, owner of the famous River Cafe in London

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by comedian Richard Herring, who talks about his tour, presenter Jamie Theakston, who discusses his radio show and actor Kayvan Novak and actress Alexandra Roach who chat about their roles in the film Cuban Fury. Plus, rock band We Are Scientists perform Make It Easy, and as always the guests contribute to the playlist by providing snippets of their favourite tracks

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldon's mother

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The friends miss the Super Bowl to attend a barman's funeral, and make a pact not to find out the score until the next day. However, adhering to the agreement proves difficult with people all around them discussing the game. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted misses his flight to Chicago for a job interview at a prestigious architecture company, so he and Robin retrace their steps to determine who is to blame. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is appointed Springfield's new sanitation commissioner, but finds it so hard to keep his elaborate election promises that he is forced to spend the year's budget allocation in his first month in charge. Featuring the guest voices of U2 and Steve Martin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Two company executives hire Homer to climb Springfield's most treacherous mountain, the ominously named Murderhorn, as a promotional stunt for their product. With the guest voice of Brendan Fraser

programme.title: Three Men and a Baby (1987)
programme.desc: The lives of three flat-sharing bachelors are turned upside down when they discover a baby left on their doorstep. Unfortunately, while trying to get to grips with the necessary parenting skills, they find themselves menaced by criminals searching for missing drugs. Comedy, directed by Leonard Nimoy, starring Tom Selleck, Ted Danson, Steve Guttenberg and Nancy Travis. Edited for language

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Contestants try to beat the banker and guess the contents of mystery boxes to win a big-money prize. In a game-changing twist, players could now win up to Â£500,000 by doubling their winnings with box 23 - if they are brave enough to buy it with what they have already won. Presented by Noel Edmonds

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a Sunday roast and curry fusion, Jimmy Doherty builds a DIY smoker and the pair try to bring back a long-forgotten pudding in Colchester. Their guest in the kitchen is former Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles, who prepares his favourite dish - a New York-style pizza

programme.title: Scandimania
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall arrives in Denmark as his Scandinavian adventure continues. In Copenhagen, he cooks with Rene Redzepi, owner of the award-winning restaurant Noma, before meeting actor Soren Malling, star of The Killing and Borgen, and architect Bjarke Ingels, who explains his concept of hedonistic sustainability. Leaving the Danish capital, Hugh visits an Efterskole - a boarding school where teenagers are taught how to be good citizens - and finishes this leg of the tour on the idyllic island of Samso, where he cooks up a feast with fellow chef Kasper Gaard

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: Police comedy drama, directed by Danny Boyle, written by Sam Bain and Jesse Armstrong (Peep Show, Fresh Meat). The Met is in need of a public image revamp, so chief constable Richard Miller has hired American visionary Liz Garvey to revolutionise the force's PR department. In an age of rolling news, smartphones and an information-hungry population, Liz preaches transparency and honesty. But as an outbreak of violence erupts across London and internal backbiting begins, her mission faces its greatest test. Starring James Nesbitt, Brit Marling, Jill Halfpenny, Paterson Joseph, Bertie Carvel and Adam Deacon

programme.title: The Bank Job (2008)
programme.desc: A London car dealer is persuaded by an old flame to rob a bank. The heist goes off without a hitch, leaving the crooks in possession of cash and jewels worth millions - as well as a safety deposit box containing top-secret information the government and security services are determined to keep buried. Fact-based crime thriller, starring Jason Statham and Saffron Burrows

programme.title: Tigerland (2000)
programme.desc: A platoon of American rookie soldiers undergoes a gruelling test of physical and mental stamina in training for the Vietnam War in 1971. The recruits all have different hopes and fears, but their fragile unity is rocked by the arrival of a rebellious recruit, whose only aim is to get out of the Army at any cost. Joel Schumacher's drama, with Colin Farrell, Matthew Davis and Clifton Collins Jr

programme.title: Boss
programme.desc: New series. Tom Kane has been the most effective Chicago mayor in recent history - but a degenerative brain disorder threatens to take everything away from him. He can no longer trust his memory, unbeknown to his wife Meredith, while his advisor Kitty O'Neil has her suspicions - and only his estranged daughter Emma has a chance of discovering his secret. Drama, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Abductees
programme.desc: Short animated film exploring the experiences of people who claim to have had extraterrestrial encounters

programme.title: Eating for Two
programme.desc: Animated film about sex, religion and the weather developed through Channel 4's Animation in Residence scheme

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help new parents Lucy and David search for a home in Surrey where they can raise baby Evie, but the couple are determined to be picky with their Â£850,000 budget. Over the border in Berkshire and Hampshire, Kelly and Emma are looking for their first home together, and when tears flow it becomes apparent there is more invested in the hunt than just money

programme.desc: Jo Frost helps Jennifer and John Atkinson, an Illinois couple with five children from different relationships. The pair's attempt to create a harmonious family environment has failed, with eldest daughter Amanda paying little attention to her mother, while youngest son Reese cannot cope when his father is not at home - leaving Jo with the difficult task of restoring order to the household

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Vince decides to give Will a symbolic birthday present to celebrate their relationship - but Grace tries to talk him out of it, knowing how her friend is likely to react. programme.desc: Debra invites her divorced parents to Thanksgiving dinner, and Raymond sees something shocking that convinces him they are getting back together. The truth, however, proves far stranger. Robert Culp and Katherine Helmond guest star

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is annoyed to discover Marie is plying his brother with gifts of scented candles and massage oils. However, his mood changes when he deduces her real motive - to put Robert in a romantic mood, in the hope he will provide her with grandchildren

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The prospect of Christmas with his son Frederick leaves Frasier panicking about what presents to buy him, and it takes a reminder from Martin about the festive spirit to keep him on the right track
