Her eclectic home impresses real-estate agent Lachlan Hosking, while former body-building champion Doreen Nicolaou feels overwhelmed by the host. Software sales executive Donna Llewellyn makes a confession about food, and train driver Tony Cook shows his appreciation for the end-of-night revelries

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Donna Llewellyn presents the second dinner party of the week, focusing on a fine-dining theme and featuring a main course of duck, much to bird-phobic Doreen's horror. She also organises a barman to serve cocktails, but after one glass too many, the host says something to Cheryl that she may regret

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Laid-back funnyman Tony Cook presents the third dinner party, and prepares aged meat on the barbecue. At the table, things are tense between Cheryl and Donna, but this does not seem to affect the overall mood of the night - until the pair fail to appreciate a joke made by the host

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Doreen Nicolaou hosts the penultimate dinner party, rewarding herself with a set of push-ups whenever a dish is prepared on schedule. Seafood is served up for the main course, and she reveals to the group that she used to be a body-building champion

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Lachlan Hosking hosts the fifth and final night, and surprises his guests with some fun entertainment in the garden. His simple and fresh take on food is a hit, but a mishap with potatoes threatens to ruin his chances of winning the cash prize

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Richard Arnold in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: In the run-up to Valentine's Day, Noel Edmonds (Mr Val Entine) presents a love-themed edition of the game show in which contestants try to guess the values of mystery boxes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eco campaigner Hector Christie holds the first dinner party in Devon, hoping his selection of raw food and home-grown produce will win him the Â£1,000 cash prize. His guests - make-up artist Kirsten Brend, slate salesman Damion Fearnley, theatre nurse Jenny Fox and retired housekeeper Viv Foster - are more interested in the stately home he lives in, so the host reveals an unusual surprise to command their attention

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: Two more contestants are introduced to the group in Sardinia, and Brendan Sheerin allows the group to visit a market following an Italian lesson. The contestants also try their hand at sea kayaking, and a couple face trouble at the vote

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Sideshow Bob returns and makes yet another attempt to kill Bart - this time with the help of his entire family. With the guest voices of Frasier stars Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The mystery of the phantom freezer unlocker is solved, but Cindy is unnerved when she discovers the truth about the culprit. However, a door left ajar becomes the least of her worries after a moment of weakness causes her to reveal her secret. Meanwhile, George hopes he has done enough to secure Vincent's release as the day of his asylum appeal arrives, and Ziggy makes a discovery that could change his future

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Benefits Britain
programme.desc: Thousands of people around the nation have had their housing benefit reduced because of a spare room in their home, leaving many with no option but to move to a smaller property. Reporter Seyi Rhodes meets those affected by the so-called bedroom tax, the Conservative politicians who are speaking out against the reform, and the councillors refusing to implement it

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits France to find out whether a glass of red wine a day keeps the doctor away, while Jimmy Doherty looks at the growing popularity of venison and how large amounts of it are now imported from New Zealand. Matt Tebbutt explores the production of skimmed milk, asking how dairy farmers get exactly the right amount of fat into every pint

programme.title: Benefits Street
programme.desc: The final visit to James Turner Street, in the Winson Green district of Birmingham, following the ongoing challenges its residents face, such as poverty, illiteracy, and drug and alcohol addiction. However, as this documentary reveals there's evidence of a strong sense of community, and proof that small acts of kindness between neighbours can go a long way. Last in the series

programme.title: The Celeb Hunter
programme.desc: Following a boldly original interview with Hollywood actress Mila Kunis for BBC Radio 1's Scott Mills Show which went viral, Chris Stark has decided to take to the road armed with a couple of his dad's camping chairs with the intention of luring celebrities into relaxed conversations. Fresh from chatting-up Jennifer Aniston and full of confidence, Chris loiters in celebrity hot spots, crashes a wedding show and stays belligerent in the face of adversity to spring his unorthodox chat-show trap and snag some big-name chat

programme.title: Payday
programme.desc: First Cut documentary following four twentysomethings over one summer in Croydon, south London, as they cope in one of the toughest economic times since the 1930s. The film focuses on their contrasting lives and finds out how well their wages see them through the month. Narrated by George the Poet

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: Short creative film by the Ballet Boyz, featuring a voyeur's vision of tenderness and aggression

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A fashion designer prepares to have a water birth having failed to attend any antenatal classes because she did not want to know about the pain. Another woman is hoping her second experience of labour will be easier than her first, but her fear becomes so great she panics. Meanwhile, a couple are keen for their child to come quickly due to the cost of hospital parking

programme.title: Scandal
programme.desc: A former government employee starts her own business as a professional crisis management expert. American drama, starring Kerry Washington

programme.title: Hostages

programme.title: World Without End

Convinced she is dying, a scarred and vengeful Petranilla sends Roland a rose contaminated with her infected blood

programme.title: Akbar's Cheetah
programme.desc: Animation from India, about the emperor of Hindustan efforts to breed big cats in captivity

programme.desc: Joe spends the night in Daphne's room, causing a shocked Frasier's mind to work overtime and Niles to become consumed by jealousy. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under

programme.desc: Warren Kibblewhite hosts the fifth and final night, but he is in for a tough time when the guests decide they want revenge for his critical approach to their own evenings. Undeterred, he sings a song and plays the guitar in an attempt to win them over

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.desc: The friends miss the Super Bowl to attend a barman's funeral, and make a pact not to find out the score until the next day. However, adhering to the agreement proves difficult with people all around them discussing the game. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted misses his flight to Chicago for a job interview at a prestigious architecture company, so he and Robin retrace their steps to determine who is to blame. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is appointed Springfield's new sanitation commissioner, but finds it so hard to keep his elaborate election promises that he is forced to spend the year's budget allocation in his first month in charge. Featuring the guest voices of U2 and Steve Martin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Two company executives hire Homer to climb Springfield's most treacherous mountain, the ominously named Murderhorn, as a promotional stunt for their product. With the guest voice of Brendan Fraser

programme.title: Three Men and a Baby (1987)
programme.desc: The lives of three flat-sharing bachelors are turned upside down when they discover a baby left on their doorstep. Unfortunately, while trying to get to grips with the necessary parenting skills, they find themselves menaced by criminals searching for missing drugs. Comedy, directed by Leonard Nimoy, starring Tom Selleck, Ted Danson, Steve Guttenberg and Nancy Travis. Edited for language

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Contestants try to beat the banker and guess the contents of mystery boxes to win a big-money prize. In a game-changing twist, players could now win up to Â£500,000 by doubling their winnings with box 23 - if they are brave enough to buy it with what they have already won. Presented by Noel Edmonds

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a Sunday roast and curry fusion, Jimmy Doherty builds a DIY smoker and the pair try to bring back a long-forgotten pudding in Colchester. Their guest in the kitchen is former Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles, who prepares his favourite dish - a New York-style pizza

programme.title: Scandimania
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall arrives in Denmark as his Scandinavian adventure continues. In Copenhagen, he cooks with Rene Redzepi, owner of the award-winning restaurant Noma, before meeting actor Soren Malling, star of The Killing and Borgen, and architect Bjarke Ingels, who explains his concept of hedonistic sustainability. Leaving the Danish capital, Hugh visits an Efterskole - a boarding school where teenagers are taught how to be good citizens - and finishes this leg of the tour on the idyllic island of Samso, where he cooks up a feast with fellow chef Kasper Gaard

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: Police comedy drama, directed by Danny Boyle, written by Sam Bain and Jesse Armstrong (Peep Show, Fresh Meat). The Met is in need of a public image revamp, so chief constable Richard Miller has hired American visionary Liz Garvey to revolutionise the force's PR department. In an age of rolling news, smartphones and an information-hungry population, Liz preaches transparency and honesty. But as an outbreak of violence erupts across London and internal backbiting begins, her mission faces its greatest test. Starring James Nesbitt, Brit Marling, Jill Halfpenny, Paterson Joseph, Bertie Carvel and Adam Deacon

programme.title: The Bank Job (2008)
programme.desc: A London car dealer is persuaded by an old flame to rob a bank. The heist goes off without a hitch, leaving the crooks in possession of cash and jewels worth millions - as well as a safety deposit box containing top-secret information the government and security services are determined to keep buried. Fact-based crime thriller, starring Jason Statham and Saffron Burrows

programme.title: Tigerland (2000)
programme.desc: A platoon of American rookie soldiers undergoes a gruelling test of physical and mental stamina in training for the Vietnam War in 1971. The recruits all have different hopes and fears, but their fragile unity is rocked by the arrival of a rebellious recruit, whose only aim is to get out of the Army at any cost. Joel Schumacher's drama, with Colin Farrell, Matthew Davis and Clifton Collins Jr

programme.title: Boss
programme.desc: New series. Tom Kane has been the most effective Chicago mayor in recent history - but a degenerative brain disorder threatens to take everything away from him. He can no longer trust his memory, unbeknown to his wife Meredith, while his advisor Kitty O'Neil has her suspicions - and only his estranged daughter Emma has a chance of discovering his secret. Drama, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.desc: Short animated film exploring the experiences of people who claim to have had extraterrestrial encounters

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.desc: Ray is annoyed to discover Marie is plying his brother with gifts of scented candles and massage oils. However, his mood changes when he deduces her real motive - to put Robert in a romantic mood, in the hope he will provide her with grandchildren

programme.desc: The prospect of Christmas with his son Frederick leaves Frasier panicking about what presents to buy him, and it takes a reminder from Martin about the festive spirit to keep him on the right track

programme.desc: The psychiatrist realises the true depth of his feelings for station manager Kate, only for her to announce she is moving to Chicago. Kelsey Grammer and Mercedes Ruehl star

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Laid-back funnyman Tony Cook presents the third dinner party, and prepares aged meat on the barbecue. At the table, things are tense between Cheryl and Donna, but this does not seem to affect the overall mood of the night - until the pair fail to appreciate a joke made by the host

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under

Reporter Seyi Rhodes meets those affected by the so-called bedroom tax, the Conservative politicians who are speaking out against the reform, and the councillors refusing to implement it

programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits France to find out whether a glass of red wine a day keeps the doctor away, while Jimmy Doherty looks at the growing popularity of venison and how large amounts of it are now imported from New Zealand. Matt Tebbutt explores the production of skimmed milk, asking how dairy farmers get exactly the right amount of fat into every pint

programme.title: Benefits Street
programme.desc: The final visit to James Turner Street, in the Winson Green district of Birmingham, following the ongoing challenges its residents face, such as poverty, illiteracy, and drug and alcohol addiction. programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Life coach MaryAnn Riddell-Birkbeck hosts the final party in Brisbane, and asks her guests to dress as Oscar winners for the evening. At the end of the night, the winner of the $2,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Slate salesman Damion Fearnley hosts the third dinner party in Devon, hoping to impress his guests with a carefully crafted menu of restaurant quality food. Unfortunately for him, two of the diners seem more intent on taking verbal swipes at each other than bites out of his food

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: Brendan takes the tourists for a tennis lesson in Nice, and dreams come true as the group plays with dolphins at a marine park. However, there are more waterworks at the vote, and someone could be waving goodbye to the coach

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy discovers her newborn son has a serious health condition, and is in urgent need of a bone marrow transplant. However, neither she nor Holly are a match, prompting Mercedes to contact the family of the infant's late father for a solution. Meanwhile, George begs Vincent to change his mind about their future together, and Leela is shocked to find herself waking up in Ziggy's bed - but all is not quite what it seems

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Furniture-maker Jamie Brown has big ideas about turning a colossal Second World War RAF bunker into his new home. However, the Nottinghamshire shelter is completely encased in earth, with no natural light, and the back section is submerged in water, leaving Jamie's wife less than confident about the project. Architect George Clarke helps tackle this huge undertaking and discovers the important role the bunker played in the Blitz

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: New series. Return of the dating show in which singletons meet up with possible partners at a restaurant, hoping to find love. Documentary following the work of Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit

programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. programme.title: NCIS

As rescue crews sift through the debris searching for survivors, Abby, Gibbs, McGee and Vance are accounted for, but Ziva and Tony are trapped in a lift. Dearing makes contact after his ex-wife is taken into custody, enabling his car to be traced to an abandoned lot - and the agents arrive just in time to see the vehicle blow up. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.desc: A collection of spectacular and death-defying stunts with the thrill-seekers who cheat death every day. When a popular driver dies, crooked prison warden Hennessey persuades Ames to take his place, claiming he will be released if he is victorious. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jason Statham, Joan Allen, Ian McShane and Tyrese Gibson

programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to find out who was responsible for sabotaging a robotic vehicle that caused the death of a Navy lieutenant and almost killed Abby. programme.desc: A female reporter investigating corporate corruption comes under suspicion when a wealthy executive is killed in an explosion. Mystery, starring father and son Dick and Barry Van Dyke alongside Lucy Butler, Roxanne Hart and John Rosenfeld

programme.desc: RSPCA inspector Vicki McDonald is called out to a house in Manchester, where she has to deal with 20 feral dogs that begin to fight violently among themselves. programme.title: Police 5
programme.desc: New series. Joe Crowley and Kate McIntyre offer advice on crime prevention, using hidden camera stunts to reveal the tricks of the thieves' trade, and also accompanying police on raids and talking to amateur detectives and have-a-go heroes who fought back in the name of justice. Shaw Taylor - who presented the original Police 5 series that ran in some ITV regions from 1962 to 1992 - returns to the screen to try to reunite theft victims with what is rightfully theirs, and there are appeals for information on the nation's most wanted criminals

programme.title: Gibraltar
programme.desc: Sgt Dylan Quigley tries to catch a thief at large on the Rock and also has to deal with two monkey incidents in one day. Dr Eric Shaw's summer of scientific research comes to end when he pays Gibraltar's population of Barbary macaques a nocturnal visit, while broadcaster and former BBC newsreader Jan Leeming flies in to attend a Battle of Britain weekend, during which she unveils the new name of RAF Gibraltar's headquarters. Last in the series

programme.title: 200 Nips & Tucks and I Want More!
programme.desc: The stories of people whose pursuit of the ultimate body has taken over their lives and led them to have a great number of cosmetic surgery procedures. In California, 58-year-old Monique has been going under the knife for more than 35 years since undergoing gender reassignment surgery, but is now registered as permanently disabled after an operation performed by an unregulated doctor went wrong. Back in Britain, 59-year-old Linda has spent more than Â£50,000 on everything from liposuction to having her toes straightened

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called to the hospital after the reported rape of a 10-year-old girl, who is so traumatised she won't speak at first, but eventually reveals that the attacker took pictures of her. A media frenzy is sparked when another victim comes forward and the detectives once again cross paths with Erik Weber, the leader of anti-paedophile vigilante group COAP, who points the finger at church warden Edwin Adelson. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick and Stephen Tobolowsky

programme.title: Body of Proof

Megan finds signs of abuse during the autopsy, which prompts the team to question the family she worked for, and Bud comes under scrutiny when the interrogation of the prime suspect goes awry. Meanwhile, Joan runs for re-election as a judge. Crime drama, starring Dana Delany

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. RAC patrols battle to reach snowed-in motorists, while heavy-recovery specialists CMG Rescue Services are out 24 hours a day tackling the aftermath of overturned HGVs and traffic collisions. In Bournemouth, RAC patroller Louise French is first on the scene at a serious accident and has to treat a casualty as she waits for the ambulance to arrive. Last in the series

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sasha faces an uncertain future when Sid tells her she cannot stay in the Bay alone, while Bianca receives a phone call and arrives at the school to find the place completely trashed. Indi tells Casey she is thinking of selling the gym, but he suggests she should keep it and put him in charge

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie is angry after finding out about Jacob's kiss with Sonya, but agrees to be his lawyer on the condition that he cuts all ties with her. Kate and Kyle enjoy a romantic moment after trying to keep their first date casual - although his reaction to seeing Georgia with another man makes Kate question whether he feels comfortable being seen in public with her

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The aftermath of Harper Dearing's bomb attack on the NCIS headquarters dominates proceedings. As rescue crews sift through the debris searching for survivors, Abby, Gibbs, McGee and Vance are accounted for, but Ziva and Tony are trapped in a lift. Dearing makes contact after his ex-wife is taken into custody, enabling his car to be traced to an abandoned lot - and the agents arrive just in time to see the vehicle blow up. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Do You Know Me (2008)
programme.desc: Premiere. A college graduate has her life transformed when she discovers a picture of a missing child on a milk carton that looks exactly like her. In her quest for answers, she discovers the terrifying truth about her past and finds her life threatened. Thriller, starring Rachelle Lefevre, Ted Whittall, Lynda Boyd and Dean Wray

programme.title: World's Scariest Stunts
programme.desc: A collection of spectacular and death-defying stunts with the thrill-seekers who cheat death every day. Daredevils featured include Matthias Giraud, who combines skiing and Base jumping, launching himself off cliffs after speeding down hostile terrain, British free-runner Damien Walters, presently employed as a stuntman on the set of James Bond film Skyfall, and Chris Birch, one of the leading freestyle motorcyclists in the UK. Other adrenaline junkies include kite surfers, white-water kayakers and unroped climbers

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sgt Carlin arrests a gang of van thieves and uncovers a major criminal operation in the process, while a late-night compost thief is caught on his way out of the shower. Officers hunt for a trucker wielding a baseball bat who has apparently succumbed to road rage and vegetarian Craggy rides to the rescue of a lorry load of calves on the A46. Elsewhere, Brian cracks down on a barbaric blood sport, Jon faces an unexploded bomb, and two fuel thieves plough straight into the interceptors' precious BMW. Documentary following the work of Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit

programme.title: Jim Davidson
programme.desc: The comedian and Celebrity Big Brother winner gives an insight into the highs and lows of his colourful personal and professional life. From hosting Saturday night favourites The Generation Game and Big Break, to his devastating arrest in 2013 and his return to the spotlight in CBB, Jim reveals how his showbiz career has been anything but straightforward

programme.title: Helix
programme.desc: Alan finds out that he might have been trusting the wrong person as he sets out to find the White Room and discover what it holds. Jules begs the others in quarantine to let her in and Balleseros is told his evacuation is on hold until he retrieves a doctor whose name does not appear on the list of staff. Sci-fi thriller, starring Billy Campbell

programme.title: Death Race (2008)
programme.desc: Jensen Ames is framed for the murder of his wife and sent to Terminal Island Prison, a facility that broadcasts the highly profitable Death Race, a high-octane event where convicts battle to the death in customised cars. When a popular driver dies, crooked prison warden Hennessey persuades Ames to take his place, claiming he will be released if he is victorious. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jason Statham, Joan Allen, Ian McShane and Tyrese Gibson

programme.title: She's 78, He's 39
programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

She decides to concentrate on trying to turn the business into the town's best three-star establishment by working on its fundamental services - but then suffers a serious setback

programme.desc: RSPCA inspector Vicki McDonald is called out to a house in Manchester, where she has to deal with 20 feral dogs that begin to fight violently among themselves. In Bristol, Miranda Albinson and Becky Jeffery investigate reports of a dog locked in a car on a hot day, while Peterborough officer Justin Stubbs receives a call from a pub where a customer has left their pet behind

programme.title: Police 5
programme.desc: New series. Joe Crowley and Kate McIntyre offer advice on crime prevention, using hidden camera stunts to reveal the tricks of the thieves' trade, and also accompanying police on raids and talking to amateur detectives and have-a-go heroes who fought back in the name of justice. Shaw Taylor - who presented the original Police 5 series that ran in some ITV regions from 1962 to 1992 - returns to the screen to try to reunite theft victims with what is rightfully theirs, and there are appeals for information on the nation's most wanted criminals

programme.title: Gibraltar
programme.desc: Sgt Dylan Quigley tries to catch a thief at large on the Rock and also has to deal with two monkey incidents in one day. Dr Eric Shaw's summer of scientific research comes to end when he pays Gibraltar's population of Barbary macaques a nocturnal visit, while broadcaster and former BBC newsreader Jan Leeming flies in to attend a Battle of Britain weekend, during which she unveils the new name of RAF Gibraltar's headquarters. Last in the series

programme.title: 200 Nips & Tucks and I Want More!
programme.desc: The stories of people whose pursuit of the ultimate body has taken over their lives and led them to have a great number of cosmetic surgery procedures. In California, 58-year-old Monique has been going under the knife for more than 35 years since undergoing gender reassignment surgery, but is now registered as permanently disabled after an operation performed by an unregulated doctor went wrong. Back in Britain, 59-year-old Linda has spent more than Â£50,000 on everything from liposuction to having her toes straightened

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called to the hospital after the reported rape of a 10-year-old girl, who is so traumatised she won't speak at first, but eventually reveals that the attacker took pictures of her. A media frenzy is sparked when another victim comes forward and the detectives once again cross paths with Erik Weber, the leader of anti-paedophile vigilante group COAP, who points the finger at church warden Edwin Adelson. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick and Stephen Tobolowsky

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: A nanny is run over and killed while trying to stop the five-year-old boy in her care from being kidnapped. Megan finds signs of abuse during the autopsy, which prompts the team to question the family she worked for, and Bud comes under scrutiny when the interrogation of the prime suspect goes awry. Meanwhile, Joan runs for re-election as a judge. Crime drama, starring Dana Delany

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Grissom takes a dangerous gamble by enlisting the help of a paedophile in an effort to find two missing 10-year-old boys. Suspicion falls on the father of one of the youngsters, but the plot thickens with the discovery that he and the other child's grandfather are sworn enemies. Drama, starring William Petersen and Marg Helgenberger

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.desc: A 22-year-old who has fallen three storeys is carefully manoeuvred out of a tight space and rushed to the Royal London Hospital, while the air ambulance team races to stabilise an elderly man who has been hit by a lorry. Elsewhere, a woman with a family history of aneurysms is experiencing dizziness, but a series of diagnostic tests only deepens the mystery, and paramedics are called out to King's Cross station to deal with a cardiac arrest

programme.desc: An elderly couple are trapped in their car following a pile-up on the A13 in Essex, and biker cop Stomp acts quickly to manage the traffic while waiting for the air ambulance to arrive. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate the death of an armoury employee when divers find her body in a car at the bottom of a lake. Meanwhile, crisis counsellor Miles Wolf carries out psychological assessments of all the agents in the wake of the bombings. Guest starring Steve Valentine (Crossing Jordan)

programme.title: Suspects
programme.desc: New series. Crime drama starring Fay Ripley, Damien Molony and Clare-Hope Ashitey, shot in a fly-on-the-wall documentary style and following the work of detectives Martha Bellamy, Jack Weston and Charlotte `Charlie' Steele. A two-year-old girl is abducted from her home and her dysfunctional family comes under immediate suspicion, but then a convicted child killer is also connected to the case. With Amanda Ryan and Penny Downie

programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return, and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. programme.title: Gavin & Stacey

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out the a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out the a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

Back in the UK, the Fiat 500 Abarth gets a test-drive and Will Young is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to make an ordinary second-hand car lap the test track as fast as a new, purpose-built sports saloon. James May meets former Formula 1 World Champion Mika Hakkinen to discover why Finns are such good racing drivers, Richard Hammond tests the Veritas sports car, and actor Mark Wahlberg is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Sean invites people to bid for the contents of abandoned big-rigs. Documentary series following former boxer Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori, as they buy storage units at auction

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori continue bidding on storage units in Boston, and make one of their biggest finds

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Cookbook
programme.desc: Part one of two. Si King and Dave Myers hop on their motorbikes and embark on a culinary voyage of discovery, sharing their joint passions for food, travel and adventure. They begin a journey along the Namibian coast, taking a trip in a microlight and sampling a traditional barbecue

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Cookbook
programme.desc: Part two of two. Simon King and David Myers' continuing tour of Namibia finds them on the trail of the Himba, one of the last remaining nomadic tribes in the world. They also encounter the local wildlife, enjoy a breakfast of fried ostrich eggs and try their hand at the local sport - long-distance spitting

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc is guest host for another half-hour of headline-related fun in the long-running quiz, with regulars Paul Merton and Ian Hislop doing their best to scrape together a few laughs from the past seven days' events. Comedian Ross Noble and the Rev Richard Coles are on the panel

programme.title: Frank Skinner Live from the Birmingham NIA
programme.desc: The comedian performs to a sell-out crowd at the National Indoor Arena in 2007

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois becomes the sex education teacher at Chris's school, but faces the wrath of parents when they learn she is being honest about the subject. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to hunt down the tooth fairy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie falls in love with an old friend, but is unhappy to discover she does not share his feelings. Meanwhile, Lois makes Peter watch `chick flicks', inspiring him to make a film of his own. With the voice of Drew Barrymore

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter volunteers to join the police force in response to a directive by the Mayor of Quahog. Meanwhile, Meg threatens to commit suicide unless she finds a date for the school prom, so Brian agrees to take her

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian accidentally sells Stewie's favourite teddy bear at a garage sale, so dog and baby embark on an epic journey to reclaim it from the buyer. Meanwhile, Peter loses his licence owing to careless driving, forcing Meg to chauffeur him everywhere

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers his mother had an affair while on holiday in Ireland 40 years previously, and crosses the Atlantic to search for his real father. Meanwhile, Stewie develops a love of punishment

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: Over a family lunch hosted by Errol's grandmother Joan (Hadyn Gwynne), Andy desperately tries to retain his bond with his nephew when Errol's other `cool' uncle, Rex, returns home from holiday. Meanwhile, Sam and Ben hit a snag in their custody battle, Errol learns he has a secret admirer, and Andy cannot help feeling tense around Joan. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Comedy show, hosted by Russell Kane, featuring a blend of stand-up routines. The youth club stages a sex education class, French bon viveur Marcel Lucont recounts some of his earliest memories and East End Cabaret provide an eye-watering tale of how to deal with a stiff situation

programme.title: Bluestone 42
programme.desc: Comedy drama about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, focusing on the camaraderie, bonds and banter the soldiers in unit Bluestone 42 share, despite the dangers they face in their work. programme.title: Bluestone 42
programme.desc: Nick is desperate to find decent food to use in an attempt to seduce Mary. Meanwhile, Simon gets into trouble on roadside operations. Comedy drama about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, starring Oliver Chris, Stephen Wright and Kelly Adams

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes
programme.desc: A selection of blunders evident in Hollywood films

programme.title: Pop's Greatest Dance Crazes
programme.desc: Robert Webb presents an abridged edition of the show looking at dance fads, exploring how the choreography for a selection of popular songs became worldwide phenomena

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which Kylie Minogue, Tom Jones, Will.i.am and Ricky Wilson seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there's a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through `blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Emma Willis and Marvin Humes present

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on the big stories dominating the media across TV, online and in print in an edition from 2011, as well as picking up on overlooked items that raise a smile

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris gets teased at school for his budget-brand trainers, and asks for money to help bring his image up to scratch - but is turned down. He attempts to steal it from his parents, but is forced into a blackmail pact when Meg confronts him and threatens to report his thieving antics. Meanwhile, Stewie and Brian become obsessed with singer Anne Murray

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: Over a family lunch hosted by Errol's grandmother Joan (Hadyn Gwynne), Andy desperately tries to retain his bond with his nephew when Errol's other `cool' uncle, Rex, returns home from holiday. programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan grows fed up with Hayley and Jeff's lazy behaviour, so he bets them he and Francine can live on the minimum wage for a month. Steve and Roger undertake a mission to test-drive their dream car

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan joins Roger and Steve's fictional detective agency, but proves to be surprisingly incompetent at his imaginary job. An infuriated Roger orders Steve to fire him - but the youngster cannot bring himself to do it. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: Comedy following Ja'mie King as she embarks upon her final three months at Hillford Girls Grammar. She has set her sights on winning both the prestigious medal for the Best Girl in Year 12, and the affections of Mitchell, a new student at nearby Kelton Boys Grammar. Starring Chris Lilley and Lester Ellis Jr

programme.desc: The Abbey Grove students prepare for their biggest football match of the school year, and Fraser decides Alfie should become coach of the team when the PE teacher disappears. programme.desc: Mary reveals a secret about her life before she was a padre - and Nick intends to take full advantage of what she discloses. Meanwhile, Bird is offered a promotion. Comedy about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, starring Kelly Adams, Oliver Chris and Katie Lyons

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Music fan Perry is given Â£12,000 to plan every aspect of his wedding to fiancee Lauren. His free-spirited bride-to-be dislikes being the centre of attention, but he is determined to put her centre stage by following in the footsteps of his idols

programme.title: Extreme Beauty Queens
programme.desc: In the first edition of her exploration of South American cultural quirks, Billie JD Porter visits the Miss Venezuela boot camp, where young women are trained to become beauty queens under the tutelage of the `King of Beauty' Osmel Sousa. She meets a 20-year-old farm girl who has given up university to focus on the competition, and an 18-year-old whose family works seven days a week to pay for the cosmetic surgery she requires to succeed and escape the slums in which she lives

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: The return of the stand-up comedy show has Dara O Briain warming up the crowd before introducing routines by ventriloquist extraordinaire Nina Conti and the irrepressible Danny Bhoy

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat cannot shake the belief that she just saw Stacey, and persuades Alfie to cut short their reunion to go searching for her cousin. Lucy discovers Danny has been embezzling money from the Butcher's Joints accounts and Denise is uncomfortable when Ian offers Fat Boy a job at the restaurant. Nancy and Whitney sign Johnny up for an online dating website - but it seems he's not the only one looking for love when Tamwar discovers Shabnam has been speaking to a mystery man

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: An unfortunate experience on a tanning bed leaves Stewie convinced he has skin cancer. Meanwhile, Chris discovers rival paper boy Kyle has stolen one of his customers - so Peter beats him up

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire loses his job as a pilot and has trouble finding alternative employment, so Peter and Cleveland hatch a plan to get him reinstated - which entails jeopardising an airliner full of passengers. With the guest voice of Hugh Hefner

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is rude to an old man in a wheelchair, who retaliates by casting a spell that makes him age rapidly. Vowing to redeem himself, the CIA agent determines to climb Kilimanjaro to reverse the curse put on him. With the voice of Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Snog, Marry, Avoid?
programme.desc: Comedienne Ellie Taylor meets the parents of over-styled children as, in south London, the Personal Overhaul Device assesses self-described `piece of art' Jess, and Meliesha, who likes to go out clubbing wearing her underwear

programme.title: Snog, Marry, Avoid?
programme.desc: Comedienne Ellie Taylor presents the makeover show that aims to uncover the UK's natural beauties. In this edition she adopts a bygone method of attracting a man on her return to Liverpool, where the Personal Overhaul Device assesses pink-obsessed Laura and Katy Perry-inspired Natasha

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their spring term, and the pace of working life shows no signs of slowing down. Science teacher Claudenia struggles to manage a group of Year 10 girls and must decide whether a confrontation is the best solution. Maths teacher Nick takes on an extra life-skills lesson, but realises he knows little about the subject and asks fellow trainee Meryl for help. Meanwhile, at the Lanfranc school in Croydon, a fight outside the school has serious consequences for one of Charles's pupils

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Mummy's girl Jo and student John head to the island Phuket on their first independent holiday, unaware that their parents will be witnessing their holiday antics - including drinking and partying- first hand

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: New series. Hollywood prosthetics are used to transform people before they go on their first dates, taking their real looks out of the equation to test whether a match can be found based purely on personality. The real faces of those involved are revealed to viewers after the couples have met. In this episode, an old man attempts to woo a witch on the dodgems while bemused members of the public look on. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Alex the world's fussiest demon undergoes a transformation before looking for romance in a cheese shop, to discover whether taking his real looks out of the equation, a match can be found based purely on personality. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is upset to learn that Lois has slept with his new friend Bill Clinton and decides to retaliate by having an affair of his own - but soon realises he loves her too much to ever be unfaithful. Meanwhile, Lois and Stewie try to potty-train Brian

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A windfall allows the Griffins to buy a restaurant, but it does not enjoy much success until Joe invites some of his disabled friends to come along - bringing Peter's prejudices to the fore

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Roger rediscovers one of his personas, Ricky Spanish, and soon remembers why he is the most hated person in Langley Falls. Meanwhile, an African child whom Stan and Francine sponsored shows up on their doorstep

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is horrified when Steve's friend Barry come close to beating his high-school wrestling record, and enlists Roger's help to defeat him. However, his plan proves to be badly flawed when Roger threatens to claim the record instead

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Mummy's girl Jo and student John head to the island Phuket on their first independent holiday, unaware that their parents will be witnessing their holiday antics - including drinking and partying- first hand

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is still in turmoil about what she believes she saw, so talks to someone she thinks will understand - but things get a little awkward when Alfie is late for their hospital appointment. Tamwar confides in Shabnam about the future of the market, so she swallows her pride and accepts a job at the Minute Mart. The news that Janine is selling off her share of the restaurant worries Ian, who is desperate to protect his empire, while Billy is devastated that he, Lucy and Danny are now unemployed. However, his Butcher's Joints colleagues have a plan up their sleeve - and it doesn't involve him. Johnny is shocked to find out the identity of his online date

programme.title: Bluestone 42
programme.desc: Nick faces a gruelling challenge with a booby-trapped car bomb, and Simon stands up to his fiancee. Comedy drama about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, starring Oliver Chris and Stephen Wright. Last in the series

programme.title: Bluestone 42 Christmas Special
programme.desc: New team member Corporal House joins the bomb disposal detachment, but his bold and cheeky attitude quickly gets him on the wrong side of Nick. Meanwhile, Bird receives unexpected news and the team decides to plan a nativity play to celebrate the festive season. Comedy drama, starring Oliver Chris, Matthew Lewis and Katie Lyons

programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the latest series of the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Mel Giedroyc, Jason Manford, Sarah Millican, Stephen Mangan, Dermot O'Leary, Charles Dance, Warwick Davis, David Harewood, Bob Mortimer, David O'Doherty and Joanna Scanlan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Last in the series

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic champion Greg Rutherford, broadcaster Kirsty Young, actress-writer Joanna Scanlan and comedian Henning Wehn join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts

Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Alex the world's fussiest demon undergoes a transformation before looking for romance in a cheese shop, to discover whether taking his real looks out of the equation, a match can be found based purely on personality. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Generation Sex
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter travels to Argentina to unlock the hidden world of one of the country's biggest passions - sex. Arriving in Buenos Aires only days before the Dia de la Primavera festival, which celebrates the first day of spring, she finds signs of sex everywhere, from the music and the partying to the steady stream of customers visiting `Telos', or love hotels. However, it also proves to be a country of contradictions, where such freedoms run up against the power of the Catholic Church

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Mummy's girl Jo and student John head to the island Phuket on their first independent holiday, unaware that their parents will be witnessing their holiday antics - including drinking and partying- first hand

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The residents of Quahog become convinced Stewie is possessed by the Devil, forcing the Griffins to flee to Texas and move in with Lois's sister. The malevolent baby then dresses up as a girl to avoid suspicions about his true identity and enters a local beauty pageant

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The principal of the local school tries to improve test scores by expelling its worst pupils, and Lois is outraged when Chris is the first student to get the chop. Peter's fight with a giant chicken continues - but the pair soon realise they have no idea why they are actually quarrelling

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is embarrassed by Steve's recreational activities, so he takes him to Mexico to teach him how to be more manly - but the plan backfires when they are kidnapped by members of a local drug cartel

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jenson hosts the edition from February 8, 1979. Includes performances from Mick Jackson, The Jacksons, Dr Feelgood, The Shadows, Darts, Rod Stewart, Elvis Costello & The Attractions, Leif Garrett, Judas Priest and Blondie. Plus, dance sequences from Legs & Co

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley's three-part documentary exploring the history of medicine concludes as he tells the story of how scientists went from finding antidotes to poisons to applying otherwise dangerous toxins as a cure. He reveals why he believes, of all the natural remedies featured in his scientific tour, the tales of treatments derived from deadly substances are perhaps the most extraordinary he encountered. Last in the series

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Author and architect Francesco da Mosto explores the countryside of Tuscany, Umbria and the Marche. He prepares pasta and picks grapes, before joining actress Maggie Smith to view Florence's art treasures. He also relates the story of St Francis of Assisi and visits a garden once owned by a British woman who fell in love with an Italian aristocrat

programme.title: Wainwright
programme.desc: Part-dramatised profile of writer and artist Alfred Wainwright, the enthusiastic fell-walker from Blackburn who became renowned for his pictorial guides to the English Lake District. More than two million copies have been sold since he began writing them in 1955, and they have become the standard reference work for the area

programme.title: Space Shuttle
programme.desc: Kevin Fong follows the scientists, engineers and astronauts of Nasa as they prepare for the 135th and final space shuttle mission. He meets the crew of the Atlantis shuttle, as well as the members of staff responsible for ensuring the craft is fully prepared for take-off, and goes behind the scenes at Florida's Kennedy Space Centre

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock joins Chris Lintott and the team as they focus on Jupiter - the largest planet in the solar system. Together they explore what causes the planet's extraordinary weather, and how its coloured bands and iconic `eye' are visible manifestations of a violent atmosphere. Guest reporter and physicist Dr Helen Czerski also explains why the planet looks the way it does

programme.title: Tomboy (2011)
programme.desc: Premiere. A 10-year-old girl moves to a new neighbourhood and is mistaken for a boy by the local kids. She decides to let them keep thinking she is male and leads a double life over the course of the summer holidays, becoming part of a gang of neighbourhood boys while her family remain oblivious. Drama, starring Zoe Heran and Malonn Levana. In French

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A classic documentary from 1984 in which Arena took the American musicians Don and Phil Everly back to the coal-mining area of Kentucky where their father Ike had also formed an act and played the guitar alongside his brothers in the 1930s. In the moody atmosphere of Muhlenberg County, the stars have an emotional reunion with three generations of Everlys. With contributions by master musician and producer Chet Atkins, songwriters Felice and Boudleaux Bryant, and the legendary guitar singer Mose Rager. Broadcast in tribute to Phil, who died just short of his 75th birthday in January

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The duo perform in a reunion concert in the autumn of 1983, staged at the Royal Albert Hall in London, which they chose because they had treasured memories of playing there with their father, Ike, a guitar virtuoso in his own right. The brothers' reconnection and subsequent live performance after 10 bitter years apart was such a high-profile event that the filming was fed live into the BBC Nine o'clock News. Arena's cameras proved that they and their unique sound could still capture the public's imagination

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Author and architect Francesco da Mosto explores the countryside of Tuscany, Umbria and the Marche. He prepares pasta and picks grapes, before joining actress Maggie Smith to view Florence's art treasures. He also relates the story of St Francis of Assisi and visits a garden once owned by a British woman who fell in love with an Italian aristocrat

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Writer Tom Cunliffe turns his attention to the Reaper, the biggest sailing lugger ever to fish the seas at 70ft long, and capable of pulling in 10 tons of herring in a single haul. He learns about the origins and history of the vessel, which played an important role in supplying food to Britain after the Second World War

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hard-working culture that existed in the Clyde shipyards, which were responsible for making the Queen Mary and QE2, despite poor working conditions and industrial relations. The programme examines how the employees' work ethic and strength of public support led them to defy the then-government's efforts to close the factories down in 1971

programme.title: Danny Baker's Rockin' Decades - The Seventies
programme.desc: New series. The irrepressible radio DJ celebrates the best of British rock music throughout the past 40 years. In the first edition, he focuses on the sounds of the 1970s in the company of former Joy Division and New Order bassist Peter Hook, Viv Albertine from the Slits, and Rolling Stone correspondent-turned-gastronome Loyd Grossman

programme.title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern
programme.desc: New series. The host (Simon Day) presents his guide to The Life of Rock from prehistoric man to the present day, in a spoof three-part chronology of some of the biggest moments in rock history. In the first episode, Pern examines rock music's prehistoric origins, tries to discover the world's smartest band, and recalls the time he dressed up as a crab

programme.title: Danny Baker Rocks the Seventies (A Bit)
programme.desc: New series. The presenter introduces a selection of archive sessions by the era's most notable artists - including the Who, Genesis, Kate Bush and the Specials

programme.title: K2 Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the 2008 expedition featuring Irish climber Ger McDonnell, who faced a heart-breaking dilemma during his attempt to conquer K2, one of the world's most dangerous peaks. The series of events is retold through re-creations, home-movie footage and interviews with survivors and family members, bringing to life one of the deadliest days in mountaineering history during which 11 people died

programme.title: Timeshift

The programme examines how the employees' work ethic and strength of public support led them to defy the then-government's efforts to close the factories down in 1971

programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe profiles the Bristol Channel pilot cutter, the design of which many sailors consider to be the perfect combination of form and function, and ideally suited to crossing one of Britain's most treacherous stretches of water

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Antiques Roadshow's Paul Atterbury recalls the heyday of the great ocean liners, travelling round Britain to reveal a story of design, politics and tragedy as he finds out how these great ships captured the public's imagination. Along the way he uncovers a cinema in Scotland built from the interiors of the SS Homeric, and visits a house in Poole, Dorset, where cabins from the Mauretania have been preserved

programme.desc: The presenter is joined by guests singer Pauline Black, comedian Adam Buxton and journalist Mark Ellen to celebrate British rock music of the 1980s. programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: New series. Leslie tries to win money for her department by sending Ann on a date with Chris, while Ron, Andy and Tom start a two-team youth basketball league. Comedy following the adventures of an over-enthusiastic American local government official, starring Amy Poehler

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie is left feeling ill after a flu outbreak, but the government official insists on making a presentation about her proposal for the town's harvest festival. Meanwhile, Ron and Andy have a day of male bonding, and Tom goes to a spa. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe tells the story of the LCVP, the Landing Craft, Vehicle, Personnel, which had a pivotal role in transporting troops during the Second World War, especially for beach landings. The writer and sailor goes aboard one of the few remaining examples to learn how this piece of machinery was developed and how it is best remembered for its part in D-Day. Last in the series

programme.title: Ancient Greece
programme.desc: Classicist Michael Scott looks at the prevalence of theatre throughout Greece as Athens began to decline during the fourth century BC, and how it conceived a new kind of comedy that is still popular today. Featuring contributions by professors Edith Hall and Paul Cartledge

programme.title: Danny Baker's Rockin' Decades - The Nineties
programme.desc: The presenter celebrates British rock as it enters the dance decade of the 1990s. Along with author and musician Louise Wener, comedian Josie Long, journalist Alexis Petridis and a slew of archive clips, the era of `Britpop' and `Madchester' is brought alive. Danny also selects a number of classic performances from the decade. Last in the series

programme.title: Danny Baker Rocks the Nineties (A Bit)
programme.desc: With the help of a couple of morris dancers, the presenter showcases performances by rocking Brits such as the Justified Ancients of Mu Mu, Radiohead, Happy Mondays and Portishead. Last in the series

programme.title: My Son the Fanatic (1997)
programme.desc: A Pakistani taxi driver who emigrated to London has turned his back on traditional Muslim culture, but finds to his dismay that his son is embracing conservative religious attitudes. Feeling like an outsider in his own family, he turns to a friendship with a prostitute hired by a regular client for solace. Drama, starring Om Puri, Akbar Kurtha, Rachel Griffiths and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Mechanical Marvels
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history of the self-operating contraptions known as automata, which were first designed hundreds of years ago but display levels of technical sophistication that continue to amaze many today. Professor Simon Schaffer examines the history behind these clockwork motor-powered machines and the hardship endured by the workers that built them. Travelling around Europe, he visits a functional automaton city, observes a robotic boy that can be programmed to write, and witnesses a device capable of playing chess

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a selection of the internet's most famous non-human stars in a rundown of the funniest animal clips to be found online. Includes footage of the ultimate dog tease, not-so-cuddly koalas, killer cats and a ruthless honey badger

programme.title: The Midnight Beast
programme.desc: The guys prepare to go on holiday after saving up enough money, but Stef discovers that Ash has changed their passport photographs into selfies, and they must lower their expectations to a camping trip under a holiday billboard in a local car park. Meanwhile, Ash strikes up a romance with social worker Jess, but tensions soon reach breaking point. Comedy, starring Stefan Abingdon, Andrew Wakely and Ashley Horne

programme.title: My Mad Fat Diary
programme.desc: Rae's world comes crashing down following Tix's deterioration and an argument with Chloe. She also loses her diary, pushing her to the brink, before a surprising `guardian angel' turns up to help her face her demons. Comedy, starring Sharon Rooney. Last in the series

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted and Marshall are keen to make Barney's stag night one to remember, so they decide to kidnap him and take him to a secret party location. However, the entertainment soon proves disappointing and Barney gets a shock when the stripper arrives. Meanwhile, Robin struggles to spend an evening with her future mother-in-law. Guest starring Frances Conroy

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted and Victoria agree to take things slowly and abstain from sex for a month, but their resolve soon weakens, and they are caught in a compromising position by Marshall and Lily. Meanwhile, Ted makes Robin his `bro' for the evening. Starring Josh Radnor and Ashley Williams

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin arranges to take fellow newsreader Sandy to an awards ceremony - prompting Barney to find the perfect date for Ted in a bid to make her jealous. Comedy, starring Cobie Smulders, Neil Patrick Harris and Josh Radnor

programme.title: The Ricky Gervais Show
programme.desc: Karl Pilkington ponders the experience of having kidney stones, and reflects on a variety of other phenomena. With Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant

programme.title: Glee
programme.desc: Principal Figgins is concerned at the number of students turning up drunk and asks the club to promote alcohol awareness in assembly. Blaine accepts Rachel's request for a date after they hit it off at a party, while Will and Coach Beiste have fun at a honky-tonk bar

programme.title: Ugly Betty
programme.desc: The investigation into the blaze at the Suarez family home is still under way, and Betty tries to speed up the inquiry by dating one of the firemen involved. Meanwhile, Hilda meets Bobby's parents, and Wilhelmina is insulted when an old flame suggests she has turned into a complete diva. Comedy, guest starring Rich Sommer (Mad Men)

programme.title: Make It or Break It
programme.desc: With the gym in turmoil following Marty's departure, Payson and Kaylie set out to discover why he abandoned them just before the nationals. Alex and Ronnie host an emergency meeting to discuss the Rock's finances and how to replace Marty

programme.title: Ugly Betty
programme.desc: An encounter with a mysterious man inspires Betty to write a feature about him for Mode, and Justin makes new friends at his acting class. Meanwhile, Wilhelmina refuses to drop her diva habits, despite being in hospital. Comedy, starring America Ferrera, Mark Indelicato and Vanessa Williams

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Jason discovers the sisters are witches and ends his relationship with Phoebe - who also has the misfortune to be possessed by a spirit. Richard tries to free himself from his family's unusual karma, while Piper and Paige tackle a group of Swarm Demons. Alyssa Milano and Eric Dane star

programme.title: The Mindy Project
programme.desc: On a night out, Mindy meets Adam, a handsome male prostitute, and decides to give him a Pretty Woman-style makeover to transform him into a suitable date for Danny and Alex's dinner party. But despite Dr Lahiri's companion's attempts at being charming, the evening does not go quite as planned

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Captain asks Lily to move to Rome for a year so she can continue to act as his consultant while he lives there, but she is afraid Marshall will feel resentful toward her if she accepts. Meanwhile, Ted and Barney are captivated by the idea of seeing a woman's figure as it is always hidden beneath a large coat. American sitcom, guest starring Kyle MacLachlan

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin tries to find her `something old', which she buried in Central Park years previously in preparation for her potential future wedding. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily ask Ted to help them pack for their trip to Italy, and Barney bonds with Robin's father

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Freddie's birthday arrives, and Sinead is determined to outdo love rival Lindsey by throwing her husband a surprise party, but the celebration does not go according to plan. Meanwhile, as the grand opening of the Hutch restaurant approaches, nerves begin to get the better of business partners Tony and Ste, who end up clashing over preparations for the big day

programme.title: Revenge
programme.desc: Daniel makes a startling statement at a party, and it becomes clear that Emily may be losing control of her intricate plan for vengeance. Meanwhile, the emergence of a new enemy forces Jack to make a decision. Drama, starring Emily VanCamp, Joshua Bowman and Nick Wechsler

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Audrey forces Jeff to give up tickets to an ice-hockey game to attend her boss's party, so he spends the evening trying to avoid finding out the score, while at the match Timmy roots for the away team. Adam finds the ideal birthday present for Jennifer

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Audrey looks into surrogacy, but frightens off a potential candidate by being overly enthusiastic, while Russell pokes fun at Jennifer and Adam's wedding website. Comedy, starring David Spade and Megyn Price

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: With their wedding looming, Robin and Barney try to relax at a restaurant, but plot revenge on a couple who ruin their evening. Ted invites Lily to see the house he has been renovating in the suburbs and shares his plans of moving to Chicago after the ceremony. Meanwhile, Marshall takes Marvin on a last-minute trip to Minnesota to see his family before leaving for Rome

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Comic-book store owner Stuart asks Amy out on a date, forcing a jealous Sheldon to consider the future of his relationship with her. Meanwhile, the scientists become obsessed with an unusual new card game, and Penny organises a round of Twister. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard confronts the man who tormented him in high school, while Penny realises she did her fair share of bullying in the past and calls the people she targeted to apologise. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD
programme.desc: When floating corpses appear, Coulson and the agents must hunt down an elusive killer in an investigation where nobody is safe. Comic-book drama co-created by Joss Whedon, guest starring Titus Welliver (The Town), with Clark Gregg, Ming-Na Wen, Brett Dalton, Chloe Bennet, Iain de Caestecker and Elizabeth Henstridge

programme.title: The Tomorrow People
programme.desc: Stephen breaks Ultra protocol during a training exercise, and Jedikiah's mysterious boss insists on meeting him. Meanwhile, Cara and John debate whether going to a nightclub party is too dangerous, and Astrid finds out what Stephen is really up to. American sci-fi drama, starring Robbie Amell, Peyton List and Luke Mitchell

programme.title: Troy
programme.desc: An extended sneak preview of the 24-year-old magician who uses everyday objects and situations to baffle and amaze unsuspecting members of the public, performing close-up tricks, studio illusions and spectacular stunts

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake meets an attractive medical examiner at a crime scene, but annoys his colleagues when his attempts to get together with her cause a hold-up with an autopsy report. Meanwhile, Amy discovers Jeffords has some hidden talents when the police sketch artist goes off sick

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is uninterested in Amy's career, so Penny, Raj and Leonard try to make him understand that sometimes it benefits a relationship to pretend to care about a partner's achievements. Howard notices Bernadette is uncomfortable around children when she helps him perform a magic show at his nephew's birthday party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard asks Penny out on a date, and they agree to give their relationship another chance. They soon remember why it did not work out in the first place, but end up sleeping together anyway. The 100th episode of the comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan

programme.title: The Running Man (1987)
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot is framed for the murder of starving civilians - and ends up being forced to take part in a brutal TV game show in which a succession of gadget-wielding killers hunt him on the streets of Los Angeles. Sci-fi action adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Yaphet Kotto, Maria Conchita Alonso and Richard Dawson

programme.title: My Mad Fat Diary
programme.desc: Rae's world comes crashing down following Tix's deterioration and an argument with Chloe. She also loses her diary, pushing her to the brink, before a surprising `guardian angel' turns up to help her face her demons. Comedy, starring Sharon Rooney. Last in the series

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Cleveland loses his confidence and takes his family on a soul-searching journey to Africa, but gets sidetracked and spends a few days in Hawaii - where he has an epiphany

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Cleveland Jr is forbidden to wear his giant pancake outfit on Halloween because his father deems it too childish, so tries to reinvent himself as a cool teenager

programme.title: The Cleveland Show

Superhero adventure, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jeff Bridges, Gwyneth Paltrow and Terrence Howard

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Sheldon tries to extend his lifespan, concerned he will not be around long enough for his consciousness to be downloaded into a robot body, and the friends encounter Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak (guest starring as himself) at the Cheesecake Factory

American sci-fi drama, starring Robbie Amell, Peyton List and Luke Mitchell

programme.title: Glee

Comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Garfield
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Rumor Has It (2005)
programme.desc: An obituary writer discovers that her mother and grandmother's affairs with the same young man decades before could have been the inspiration for the book and film The Graduate. Intrigued by the possibility, she sets off for San Francisco to find the charmer who left her relatives reeling. Rob Reiner's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston, Kevin Costner and Shirley MacLaine. Including FYI Daily

Her plans crumble as she tries to deal with her mother's infidelity, get over a passionate fling with her boss and come to terms with her feelings for an uptight lawyer. Romantic comedy, based on Helen Fielding's novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas (2000)
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski

programme.title: Garfield
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry

programme.title: Rumor Has It (2005)
programme.desc: An obituary writer discovers that her mother and grandmother's affairs with the same young man decades before could have been the inspiration for the book and film The Graduate. Intrigued by the possibility, she sets off for San Francisco to find the charmer who left her relatives reeling. Rob Reiner's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston, Kevin Costner and Shirley MacLaine
